translated: One lives a life of danger through body and speech.

original: de lus kyis ni rku ba dang gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de lus kyis ni rku ba dang gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa dag gis so //
translated: Through body, by stealing and cheating on the scales, etc.

original: ngag gis ni brdzun @51b du smra ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ngag gis ni brdzun @51b du smra ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Through speech, by lying, etc.

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa nyid do //
translated: The antidote to these is the purity of livelihood.

original: sog 'jog byed pas yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sog 'jog byed pa ni stsogs pa ste /
analyzed: sog 'jog byed pas yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sog 'jog byed pa ni stsogs pa ste /
translated: From the point of view of the enjoyment of what is stored up, etc. storing up is storing up through greed.

original: de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: That is a condition for desire, etc.

original: de nyid bshad pa la /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa la /
translated: That is explained:

original: de la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so //
analyzed: de la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so //
translated: Therein, attachment is through desire.

original: de'i dgra bo de la 'dod pa rnams zhe sdang gis sdang ngo //üîΩde la yon tan du 'dzin pa ni gti mug gis te /
analyzed: de'i dgra bo de la 'dod pa rnams zhe sdang gis sdang ngo // de la yon tan du 'dzin pa ni gti mug gis te /
translated: Hatred is the enemy of desire,üîΩand delusion is the enemy of both.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Delusion is the enemy of both desire and hatred, because it is the cause of the non-abandonment of desire and hatred.

original: 'di yang gsum gyi gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang gsum gyi gzhi dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the verse: ‚ÄúThe basis of the three, the burning of body and mind, the great misery of the hells.‚Äù

original: sog 'jog de nyid yongs su spyod pa'i tshe yul la nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs sgo mang po sgo sna tshogs nas kun nas bslang bas rgyun mi 'chad par dus thams cad du lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba kun nas gdung ba ni nyes paüîΩgnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sog 'jog de nyid yongs su spyod pa'i tshe yul la nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs sgo mang po sgo sna tshogs nas kun nas bslang bas rgyun mi 'chad par dus thams cad du lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba kun nas gdung ba ni nyes pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second fault is that, when one is enjoying the very same stored-up goods, the afflictions of the sense-objects are aroused in many ways, through many doors, and one is tormented by the burning of body and mind, which is uninterrupted and continuous.

original: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi me lce rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa kun du 'bar bar gyur zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi me lce rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa kun du 'bar bar gyur zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The third fault is that the flames of the various afflictions are always burning without interruption.

original: tshe 'di dang phyi ma la sogs pa de nyid kyi nyes dmigs de ma mthong ba rnams nges par 'byung ba mi tshol ba ni nyes pa gsum pa'o ;
analyzed: tshe 'di dang phyi ma la sogs pa de nyid kyi nyes dmigs de ma mthong ba rnams nges par 'byung ba mi tshol ba ni nyes pa gsum pa'o ;
translated: The third fault is that those who do not see the disadvantages of this life and the next, etc. do not seek liberation.

original: / ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa gsum po yongs su spong ba'i phyir de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba 'tshe ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: / ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pa gsum po yongs su spong ba'i phyir de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba 'tshe ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: The three faults as they have been explained are abandoned by the three remedies which are their opposites. The three phrases ‚Äúthe nirvana which is harmless, the complete pacification of all addictions,‚Äù teach the three remedies.

original: 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams kyis yongs su spyod pas byas pa'i bye brag rnam pa gsum brjod nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa rnams kyis yongs su spyod pas byas pa'i bye brag rnam pa gsum brjod nas /
translated: Having described the three kinds of differences produced by the enjoyment of those who are engaged in the pursuit of desires,

original: da ni gnyis pa kun du tshol bas byas pa'i bye brag rnam pa gnyis po gzhan gang yin pa de bshad pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: da ni gnyis pa kun du tshol bas byas pa'i bye brag rnam pa gnyis po gzhan gang yin pa de bshad pa la 'jug ste /
translated: now he begins the explanation of the second kind of difference, that produced by the pursuit itself.

original: gti mug gi mun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe darkness of delusion,‚Äù etc.

original: gti mug nyid mun pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug nyid mun pa ste /
translated: Delusion itself is darkness.

original: de yang rab rib la sogs pa nyid kyis khyad par byed do //
analyzed: de yang rab rib la sogs pa nyid kyis khyad par byed do //
translated: It is distinguished by the words ‚Äúdimness,‚Äù etc.

original: rab rib la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa nyid las rgyu gsum bshad do //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa nyid las rgyu gsum bshad do //
translated: The three causes are explained in the commentary in order to show that the obscurations are like cataracts, etc.

original: de nyid las rab rib la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rab rib la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The commentary explains that the obscurations are like cataracts, etc.

original: 'di yang gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib dang ling tog dang mun gnag @52a * //
analyzed: 'di yang gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib dang ling tog dang mun gnag @52a * //
translated: The obscurations are like cataracts, etc. of delusion, darkness, and gloom.

original: ces bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the obscurations.

original: ji skad bshad pa de'i rgyu brtas pa ni 'jug pa shas che ba ste bag la nyal ni sa bon no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa de'i rgyu brtas pa ni 'jug pa shas che ba ste bag la nyal ni sa bon no //
translated: The increase of the cause of the obscurations as they have been explained is their predominance, and their latency is their seed.

original: der gyur pa gti mug de'i rgyu bag la nyal brtas par gyur pa yang nyes pa ste /
analyzed: der gyur pa gti mug de'i rgyu bag la nyal brtas par gyur pa yang nyes pa ste /
translated: The increase of the latency of delusion, which is the cause of the obscurations, is their fault.

original: gti mug mun pa'i thibs por zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug mun pa'i thibs por zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The obscurations are said to be the entry into the thick darkness of delusion.

original: bag la nyal sa bon de nyid thibs po yin par bshad do //
analyzed: bag la nyal sa bon de nyid thibs po yin par bshad do //
translated: The latency of the seed of the obscurations is explained as their thickness.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab las ring du gyur pa yang nyes pa'o zhes bya bar snyegs te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab las ring du gyur pa yang nyes pa'o zhes bya bar snyegs te /
translated: The obscurations are also a fault because they are far from uncontaminated wisdom.

original: nyes pa snga ma gnyis la ltos nas 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: nyes pa snga ma gnyis la ltos nas 'dir yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The term also is used here in reference to the two previous faults.

original: ji ltar ring bar gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar ring bar gyur zhe na ;
translated: How are they far removed?

original: de'i tshogs legs par spyad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la brten pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshogs legs par spyad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la brten pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause they are based on the opposite of the requisites for that.‚Äù

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: The sutra states,

original: shes rab kyi snang ba dang ring du gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba dang ring du gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are far removed from the light of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gnod pa chen po'i gnas ngan song du 'gro ba mun nag chen po'i nang du 'jug pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa chen po'i gnas ngan song du 'gro ba mun nag chen po'i nang du 'jug pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey enter the great darkness of the lower realms, which are the abode of great harm.‚Äù

original: sdig pa byas pa rnams kyi mtshan ma mi bzad pa gang dag yin ba de 'chi ba'i tshe 'byung ste /
analyzed: sdig pa byas pa rnams kyi mtshan ma mi bzad pa gang dag yin ba de 'chi ba'i tshe 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe terrible signs of having committed evil deeds appear at the time of death.

original: de mthong bas 'gyod pa dang bcas yid mi bde ba dang bcas pa'i mthong bas 'chi ste yang ba mthong bar spags pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de mthong bas 'gyod pa dang bcas yid mi bde ba dang bcas pa'i mthong bas 'chi ste yang ba mthong bar spags pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Seeing them, one dies with regret and mental distress. One dies with a bad death. One dies with a bad mind.‚Äù

original: nyes pa bzhi po 'di dag ni nyes par spyod pas tshe 'di la tshol ba rnams kyi yin par bshad de /
analyzed: nyes pa bzhi po 'di dag ni nyes par spyod pas tshe 'di la tshol ba rnams kyi yin par bshad de /
translated: These four faults are said to pertain to those who pursue their livelihood through evil deeds in this life.

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni shes rab kyi mig rnam par sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni shes rab kyi mig rnam par sbyong ba'o //
translated: The antidote that is in accordance with them is the purification of the eye of wisdom.

original: legs par spyod pas tshe rabs gzhan kun tu tshol ba rnams kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: legs par spyod pas tshe rabs gzhan kun tu tshol ba rnams kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Having in mind those who seek in other lives by good conduct, he said:

original: lam yang bar zhugs pa nyid nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: lam yang bar zhugs pa nyid nyes pa yin no //
translated: The fault is the very entry into the path.

original: de ni rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la rang bzhin ni 'dir 'khor ba 'brog ya nga ba'i lam yin par brjod par bzhed pa de tshig dang po nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la rang bzhin ni 'dir 'khor ba 'brog ya nga ba'i lam yin par brjod par bzhed pa de tshig dang po nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: Therein, the nature is the wilderness of cyclic existence, the path of fear, which is indicated by the first word.üîΩThe obstacles are of eight kinds:

original: bgegs ni rnam pa brgyad de g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs ni rnam pa brgyad de g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: facing an abyss, facing the abyss of the hells, etc.

original: rgyu'i nang du zhugs pa ni /üîΩsdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa'i lta ba la gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu'i nang du zhugs pa ni / sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa'i lta ba la gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Entering into a cause,üîΩbecause of abiding in the view that is the opposite of the truth of suffering,

original: lta ba ngan pa'i rgyu nyam nga bar zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i rgyu nyam nga bar zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: entering into a cause of bad views.

original: thibs pos kun nas @52b g-yogs pa ni de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: thibs pos kun nas @52b g-yogs pa ni de'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of that is the thick darkness.

original: bde bar lta ba phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid de'i rgyu gti mug gi bag la nyal gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar lta ba phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid de'i rgyu gti mug gi bag la nyal gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is the latent tendency to confusion, which is the error of viewing what is suffering as blissful.

original: des 'gebs pa'i phyir de nyid gti mug thibs po yin te /
analyzed: des 'gebs pa'i phyir de nyid gti mug thibs po yin te /
translated: That is thick darkness, because it obscures the truth.

original: gti mug thibs pos kun nas g-yogs pa ni zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug thibs pos kun nas g-yogs pa ni zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that those who are covered by thick darkness

original: gti mug thibs po gang dang ldan pa rnams brjod du zin kyang gang la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir bde bar lta bar bshad pa'i sdug bsngal de'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs te de nyid kyi phyir gti mug gi bag la
analyzed: gti mug thibs po gang dang ldan pa rnams brjod du zin kyang gang la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir bde bar lta bar bshad pa'i sdug bsngal de'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs te de nyid kyi phyir gti mug gi bag la
translated: Even though it is said that those who have thick darkness are confused, they do not understand the nature of the suffering that is explained as the view of bliss, because they are confused about it.

original: nyal 'di ni de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nyal 'di ni de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, this latent tendency to confusion is its cause.

original: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa ni don dam pa'i bde ba thar pa'i phyir gdung ba lnga la sogs pa lam log par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa ni don dam pa'i bde ba thar pa'i phyir gdung ba lnga la sogs pa lam log par zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: They enter the wrong path, because they enter the wrong path of the five fires, etc. for the sake of the ultimate bliss of liberation.

original: lam log par gol ba'i lam du zhugs pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lam log par gol ba'i lam du zhugs pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are said to have entered the path of error.

original: ldongs par gyur pa ni 'dod chags kyi chags pa des ldongs par gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ldongs par gyur pa ni 'dod chags kyi chags pa des ldongs par gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are blind because they are blinded by the passion of desire.

original: ldongs par gyur pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ldongs par gyur pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are said to be blind.

original: ston pa dang bral ba ni mi khom par skyes pa dang / khom du zin kyang bag med pa'i nyes pas sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa dang bral ba ni mi khom par skyes pa dang / khom du zin kyang bag med pa'i nyes pas sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are devoid of a teacher because they are born in an unfavorable state of existence, or even if born in a favorable state, they are incapable of pleasing the Buddhas because of the fault of heedlessness.

original: de'i bstan pa'i rjes su byed pas bslab pa bsrung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas mnyes pa yin na de gnyis kyis bslab pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir mnyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bstan pa'i rjes su byed pas bslab pa bsrung ba'i phyir sangs rgyas mnyes pa yin na de gnyis kyis bslab pa'i skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir mnyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one pleases the Buddha by following his teaching and by observing the precepts, they do not please him because they are not fit for the precepts and because they are not like him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag dge ba la sbyar ba'i 'os su gyur pa ma yin pas ston pa bcom ldan 'das de dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag dge ba la sbyar ba'i 'os su gyur pa ma yin pas ston pa bcom ldan 'das de dang bral ba yin no //
translated: For this very reason, they are not fit to be applied to virtue, and so they are devoid of the teacher, the Blessed One.

original: yongs su 'dren pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa med pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are said to be without a guide.

original: gang du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par ro //
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere will you go?‚Äù means to nirvana.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa ni 'khor ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa ni 'khor ba kho na yin no //
translated: The world of Brahma, etc., are only samsara.

original: de nyid nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa la nges par 'byung bar lta ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa la nges par 'byung bar lta ba zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said in ‚Äúview of release in what is not release.‚Äù

original: chom pos zin pa yang zhes bya ba ni bgegs brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: chom pos zin pa yang zhes bya ba ni bgegs brgyad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso seized by a bandit‚Äù is the eighth hindrance.

original: bgegs snga ma la ltos nas yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: bgegs snga ma la ltos nas yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used in reference to the previous hindrance.

original: bdud kyi yul 'dod pa rnams la kun du chags pa'i bsod nams bdag pa yang zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul 'dod pa rnams la kun du chags pa'i bsod nams bdag pa yang zad par 'gyur la /
translated: One who is attached to the objects of desire, the domain of Mara, will exhaust his merit and

original: ma byas pa yang mi stsogs so //
analyzed: ma byas pa yang mi stsogs so //
translated: will not accumulate any more.

original: de'i phyir bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is ‚Äúdefeated,‚Äù

original: bdud kyi lam gyi chom pos zin pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi lam gyi chom pos zin pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: as it is said, ‚Äúseized by a bandit on the path of Mara.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa rnams nyid bdud kyi lam yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams nyid bdud kyi lam yin la /
translated: The objects of desire are the path of Mara.

original: dge ba'i nor 'phrog pa'i phyir chom po yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i nor 'phrog pa'i phyir chom po yin no //
translated: They are a bandit because they steal the wealth of virtue.

original: de ltar rang bzhin dang bgegs kyi sgo nas ya nga ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin dang bgegs kyi sgo nas ya nga ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught danger in terms of nature and hindrance,üîΩhe teaches danger in terms of the three miseries.

original: chud za ba'i sgo nas ston te /
analyzed: chud za ba'i sgo nas ston te /
translated: It is taught by way of loss.

original: chud za ba rnam pa gsum @53a * //
analyzed: chud za ba rnam pa gsum @53a * //
translated: There are three kinds of loss.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos so //
translated: And so on, it is said in detail.

original: sa ngan pa la gnas pa'i phyir ni yongs su 'dren pa mkhas pa dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa ngan pa la gnas pa'i phyir ni yongs su 'dren pa mkhas pa dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is taught by way of the bad ground, as in the statement, ‚ÄúThey are deprived of the skill of the good guide.‚Äù

original: dgra'i sa na gnas pa ni bdud kyi bsam pa thibs por zhugs zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra'i sa na gnas pa ni bdud kyi bsam pa thibs por zhugs zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is taught by way of the ground of the enemy, as in the statement, ‚ÄúThey enter the thick forest of Mara‚Äôs intentions.‚Äù

original: zin gyi sa las ring du gyur pa ni sangs rgyas la sems pa las ring du gyur pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zin gyi sa las ring du gyur pa ni sangs rgyas la sems pa las ring du gyur pa zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is taught by way of the ground of the far shore, as in the statement, ‚ÄúThey are far from the thought of Buddha.‚Äù

original: de ltar na phyi rol gyi rnam pa dang chos mthun par rang bzhin dang / bgegs dang chud za ba'i sgo nas 'khor ba ya nga ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na phyi rol gyi rnam pa dang chos mthun par rang bzhin dang / bgegs dang chud za ba'i sgo nas 'khor ba ya nga ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, samsara is taught to be fearful by way of its similarity to the external form, by way of its nature, by way of its obstacles, and by way of its loss.

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni bsgral nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer 'jigs pa med pa la dgod do //
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni bsgral nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer 'jigs pa med pa la dgod do //
translated: The antidote that corresponds to that is the one that delivers them and establishes them in the fearless city of omniscience.

original: de ltar thun mong ma yin pa dang / chog mi shes pa dang / sog 'jog byed pa'i yongs su spyod pa'i sgo dang / yang dag pa dang log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa gnyis kyi bye brag gis 'dod pa tshol ba rnam pa lngar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar thun mong ma yin pa dang / chog mi shes pa dang / sog 'jog byed pa'i yongs su spyod pa'i sgo dang / yang dag pa dang log pa'i tshangs par spyod pa gnyis kyi bye brag gis 'dod pa tshol ba rnam pa lngar bstan nas /

translated: in order to attain freedom from passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung bar byed pa rgyu rnam pa bcu la yang dag par brten te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung bar byed pa rgyu rnam pa bcu la yang dag par brten te /
translated: He strives in the ten causes for the arising of the application to freedom from passion.

original: sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu po zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu po zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The ten mental contemplations are mentioned.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa ni sems kyi bsam pa gang gis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa ni sems kyi bsam pa gang gis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mental contemplation of freedom from passion is the mental contemplation by which one becomes free from passion.

original: de'i rgyu yid la byed pa ni gang dag mngon du byas na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yid la byed pa ni gang dag mngon du byas na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The mental contemplation of its cause is the mental contemplation of those things that, when realized, lead to the attainment of the mental contemplation of freedom from passion.

original: bsam gtan bzlog nus pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi mthu'i 'bras bu de bzlog nus pa nyid du rig par bya ba'i bsam gtan nyid bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzlog nus pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyi mthu'i 'bras bu de bzlog nus pa nyid du rig par bya ba'i bsam gtan nyid bzlog pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe power of meditative absorption can be reversed‚Äù should be understood to mean that the power of meditative absorption can be reversed, and that the meditative absorption itself is not reversed.

original: 'dor ba dang 'bral ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dor ba dang 'bral ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the meditative absorption is abandoned or relinquished.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mjug thogs su 'og mar skye ba dang yongs su mi nyams pa gnyis kyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mjug thogs su 'og mar skye ba dang yongs su mi nyams pa gnyis kyis zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /

original: bsam gtan rnam pa thams cad du bor ram bral na ni yongs su nyams par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa thams cad du bor ram bral na ni yongs su nyams par mi rung ngo //
translated: If the meditative absorption were completely lost or abandoned, it would not be possible for it to degenerate.

original: de lta bas na 'dir bsam gtan gyi mthu bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir bsam gtan gyi mthu bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this context, the power of meditative absorption should be understood as something that can be reversed.

original: gal te 'di yang ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di yang ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how that is possible,

original: 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid de /
translated: it is because of the inconceivable nature of the Buddha‚Äôs power.

original: de skad du //
analyzed: de skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: thabs chen dang ni ldan rnams la //
analyzed: thabs chen dang ni ldan rnams la //
translated: For those who possess the great means,

original: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs byang chub yan lag gyur //
translated: The afflictions become the branches of enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba dang zhi ba'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang zhi ba'i bdag nyid de //
translated: The nature of cyclic existence and peace

original: de phyir bya dka' chung zad med //üîΩces gsungs so //
analyzed: de phyir bya dka' chung zad med //üîΩces gsungs so //
translated: Is such that there is nothing difficult to do.

original: de nyid kyi phyir der yang skye la kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med pa nyid @55a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir der yang skye la kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med pa nyid @55a * //
translated: Therefore, one is born there and is also free from defilement.

original: du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: du brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is what should be said.

original: sa 'di la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na 'jug pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sa 'di la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na 'jug pa yang ma yin la /

original: zhugs ma thag tu 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di nyid la 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhugs ma thag tu 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin te / 'di nyid la 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung bar byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /

original: sa 'di la gnas pa 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩchags bral sbyor ba nas bzung ste //üîΩchags bral thob pa yan chad du //
analyzed: sa 'di la gnas pa 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba khong du chud par bya'o // chags bral sbyor ba nas bzung ste // chags bral thob pa yan chad du //
translated: One should understand that one becomes free from attachment while abiding in this stage, because the preparation for freedom from attachment occurs in this stage and because the classification of the preparation for freedom from attachment occurs in this stage.üîΩThe stages of preparation are explained as three:üîΩfrom the preparation for freedom from attachment

original: 'dod chags bral ba thob bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral ba thob bya'i phyir //

original: sbyor ba'i sa rnams gsum du bshad //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sa rnams gsum du bshad //
translated: The stages of preparation are explained as three:üîΩfrom the preparation for freedom from attachment up to but not including the attainment of freedom from attachment.

original: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag bar so sor rtog ces bya ba nas bzung ste tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag bar so sor rtog ces bya ba nas bzung ste tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: He examines all conditioned things as impermanent, and so on up to: ‚ÄúHe does not do so with just a pure verbal act.üîΩHe is engaged in guarding against the Individual Vehicle, and so on in detail.

original: theg pa dman pa las kun tu srung bar sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba de la gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa las kun tu srung bar sbyor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba de la gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In dependence upon‚Äù means in dependence upon the knowledge of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes sa bcu pa la yang mi 'thob pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes sa bcu pa la yang mi 'thob pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the knowledge of the TathƒÅgata not attained even on the tenth stage?

original: de ji ltar sa gsum pa'i rten zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sa gsum pa'i rten zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that it is the basis of the third stage?

original: ma thob kyang dmigs pa'i ngo bor brten nas zhes bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ma thob kyang dmigs pa'i ngo bor brten nas zhes bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because it is said that ‚Äúin dependence upon‚Äù means in dependence upon the object.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú For the sake of‚Äù means for the sake of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyis te ;
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu sbyor bar byed pa ni brtson 'grus kyis te ;
translated: ‚Äú How is he engaged?‚Äù He is engaged through his effort.

original: 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su bskyab par bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su bskyab par bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: These are indicated by the words: ‚ÄúI must protect them, etc.

original: mthu nyid yon tan te /
analyzed: mthu nyid yon tan te /
translated: The quality of power is

original: de yongs su 'dzin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yongs su 'dzin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: the possession of the inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the possession of the inconceivable power of the Buddha‚Äôs magical emanations, etc.üîΩThe quality of the possession of the perfection of full enlightenment is the absence of equality.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya ba ste thun mong ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas zla med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya ba ste thun mong ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas zla med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of an equal, because of the unique full enlightenment.

original: don chen po nyid kyi yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni dpag tu med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don chen po nyid kyi yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni dpag tu med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The quality of the possession of the great meaning is the immeasurability.üîΩIt is the immeasurability of the great meaning.

original: tshad bzung du med pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni rnyed dka' ba nyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tshad bzung du med pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni rnyed dka' ba nyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The quality of the possession of the difficulty of attainment is the rarity.üîΩIt is the rarity of the attainment of the great meaning.

original: mgo dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa sbyin pa'i sdug bsngal khas blangs pas thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgo dang lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa sbyin pa'i sdug bsngal khas blangs pas thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has accepted the suffering of giving away his head, arms, legs, and so on.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni ma 'dres pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni ma 'dres pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The possession of uncommon qualities is called ‚Äúunsharedness.‚Äù

original: sngar ni khyad par @55b med par mi mtshungs pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas bshad kyi /
analyzed: sngar ni khyad par @55b med par mi mtshungs pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas bshad kyi /
translated: Previously, it was explained that the Buddha is fully enlightened without a superior, without distinguishing his qualities.

original: da ni de'i yon tan dang 'dra ba'i tshul gyis cha tsam gyi sgo nas kyang bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra ba med do zhes bya ba yin pas khyad par yod do //üîΩrnam par dag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni gnod pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni de'i yon tan dang 'dra ba'i tshul gyis cha tsam gyi sgo nas kyang bcom ldan 'das dang 'dra ba med do zhes bya ba yin pas khyad par yod do // rnam par dag pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni gnod pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Now, it is said that there is a distinction, because there is no one equal to the Lord, even in a partial or approximate sense, in terms of the possession of qualities similar to his.üîΩPurity, etc. Freedom from suffering is called ‚Äúnon-injury.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni 'khrug pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni 'khrug pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Freedom from the suffering of the passions is called ‚Äúnon-agitation.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba nyid ces bya ba ste tshigs 'og ma gnyis ni de khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba nyid ces bya ba ste tshigs 'og ma gnyis ni de khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: Attaining nirvana is going to the city of fearlessness. The next two lines are a specification of that.

original: de la yongs su bskyab par bya zhes bya bzhi gtso bo'i tshig yin no ;
analyzed: de la yongs su bskyab par bya zhes bya bzhi gtso bo'i tshig yin no ;
translated: Of those, the four lines beginning with ‚ÄúI will protect‚Äù are the principal words.

original: / gang las yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni gang las te /üîΩlas kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni dgrol bar bya zhing /
analyzed: / gang las yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni gang las te / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni dgrol bar bya zhing /
translated: From what will one be protected? From that.üîΩFrom the defilement of action, one should be freed;

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni yongs su sbyang bar bya la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni yongs su sbyang bar bya la /
translated: from the defilement of the afflictions, one should be purified;

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni gdon par bya'o //
translated: from the defilement of birth, one should be rescued.

original: ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni ji ltar gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni ji ltar gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: How will one be protected? How will one be established?

original: tshul khrims la gzhag pa dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag ba'i shes rab la ltos nas dgod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gzhag pa dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag ba'i shes rab la ltos nas dgod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In terms of the superior morality, mind, and wisdom, one should be established.

original: tshig 'di gnyis ni yan lag yin te /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis ni yan lag yin te /
translated: These two lines are the branches.

original: tshig gzhan gyis bshad do //
analyzed: tshig gzhan gyis bshad do //
translated: The rest is explained by the words.

original: de la tshul khrims la gzhag pa'i phyir yongs su tshim par bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhag par bya ba zhes bya ba tshig gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims la gzhag pa'i phyir yongs su tshim par bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhag par bya ba zhes bya ba tshig gnyis bstan to //
translated: In this regard, the two phrases ‚Äúto satisfy‚Äù and ‚Äúto establish‚Äù are taught in order to establish morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la ltos te gdul bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la ltos te gdul bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto be disciplined‚Äù is taught in order to establish meditative concentration and wisdom.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar yongs su skyob pa por 'gyur ba de bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni ji ltar yongs su skyob pa por 'gyur ba de bshad do //

original: de'i lam sgom par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i lam sgom par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto cause them to cultivate the path‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la ston pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la ston pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: teaches the knowledge of the path of the omniscient one, the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba ni sems can rnams te /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba ni sems can rnams te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto ripen‚Äù refers to sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par byas la brtson zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par byas la brtson zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto strive to protect all sentient beings‚Äù teaches this.

original: mthar phyin pa rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto realize the culmination‚Äù and so forth.

original: mthar phyin pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ni sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: The culmination is buddhahood itself.

original: de nyid rnam par thar pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par thar pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: That is the state of liberation.

original: chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the characteristic of the body of truth.

original: de la ma gtogs par gzhan sems can gyi don gyi thabs med do snyam du de ltar nges pa ni mthar phyin par rtogs pa'o //üîΩsangs rgyas mthar phyin pa de yang byang chub sems @56a * //üîΩdpa'i mthar phyin pa thams cad rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin pas de ltar na mthar phyin pa sgrub pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs par gzhan sems can gyi don gyi thabs med do snyam du de ltar nges pa ni mthar phyin par rtogs pa'o // sangs rgyas mthar phyin pa de yang byang chub sems @56a * // dpa'i mthar phyin pa thams cad rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin pas de ltar na mthar phyin pa sgrub pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Thinking that there is no other means for the benefit of sentient beings apart from that, the realization of the culmination is the ascertainment of that.üîΩThat culmination of buddhahood does not occur without the characteristic of the realization of the culmination of all bodhisattvas. Thus the realization of the accomplishment of the culmination is the tenth stage.

original: mthar phyin pa sgrub pa sa bcu pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang sa 'og mas bsdus pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes med na mi 'byung bas de ltar na mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa sgrub pa sa bcu pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang sa 'og mas bsdus pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes med na mi 'byung bas de ltar na mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That very essence of the accomplishment of the culmination is not attained without the nonconceptual wisdom subsumed by the lower stages. Thus the realization of the higher and higher accomplishment of the culmination is the tenth stage.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa gnyi ga dang bral ba la ltos nas rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa gnyi ga dang bral ba la ltos nas rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In consideration of the absence of both the conceptual differentiation of the individual and general characteristics, he says: without movement and without origination.

original: sa'i ye shes don dam pa pa de lta bu de yang bsam gtan la mkhas pa med na med pas de ltar na mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong ma gong ma rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa'i ye shes don dam pa pa de lta bu de yang bsam gtan la mkhas pa med na med pas de ltar na mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong ma gong ma rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, that suchness of the knowledge of the spiritual levels does not exist without skill in meditative concentration; thus, the latter is the realization of the higher and higher accomplishments.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba gzhan ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba gzhan ston par byed pa ste /
translated: Again indicates another inclusion.

original: snga ma ni gzhi tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni gzhi tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The former is a different basis.

original: da ni bsam gtan la mkhas pa nyid rnam par nges pa yin la so sor rtog pa yang yin pas zhes gzhi mthun par bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan la mkhas pa nyid rnam par nges pa yin la so sor rtog pa yang yin pas zhes gzhi mthun par bsdu ba yin no //

original: mkhas pa de yang thos pa la mkhas pa med pas de ltar na de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa de yang thos pa la mkhas pa med pas de ltar na de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba yin te /

original: de sgrub pa ni bsam gtan la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pa ni bsam gtan la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of that is skill in meditative concentration.

original: de'i gnas ni thos pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni thos pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The basis of that is skill in learning.

original: la la las rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: la la las rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra yang 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: Some texts have the word ‚Äúrealization‚Äù in place of ‚Äúapplication.‚Äù

original: der ni gnas kyi phyir sbyor ba zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'i rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni gnas kyi phyir sbyor ba zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'i rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúapplication‚Äù should be applied in the sense of ‚Äúabiding‚Äù and not in the sense of ‚Äúrealization.‚Äù

original: gang yongs su spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams lus kyi gnod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir nor gtong ste /
analyzed: gang yongs su spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams lus kyi gnod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir nor gtong ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to abandon‚Äù means that worldly people give up their wealth in order to abandon physical harm.

original: lus kyi gnod pa de dag kyang nyams su len to //
analyzed: lus kyi gnod pa de dag kyang nyams su len to //
translated: They also endure physical harm.

analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa las 'phags pa rnams kyis brjod ces ma bshad ce na /

original: de dag ga gnod pa rnams rags pa'i phyir gzhan gyis bstan pas go bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ga gnod pa rnams rags pa'i phyir gzhan gyis bstan pas go bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because the first and second absorptions are not free from the fault of gross states.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la ni 'di ni bde ba'o snyam pa'i sems kyi rtsol ba gang yin pa de nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par bshad cing nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'di yang cha phra ba la bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba yang mchog yin
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la ni 'di ni bde ba'o snyam pa'i sems kyi rtsol ba gang yin pa de nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin par bshad cing nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'di yang cha phra ba la bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa'i bde ba yang mchog yin
translated: This is the subtle aspect of the third absorption and its pleasure is supreme.

original: pas bsam gtan pa 'di bde ba mchog gi chang 'thungs pas ra ro ste bdag nyid kyis rjes su rtogs par mi nus par mkhyen nas de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa rnams brjod do //
analyzed: pas bsam gtan pa 'di bde ba mchog gi chang 'thungs pas ra ro ste bdag nyid kyis rjes su rtogs par mi nus par mkhyen nas de khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa rnams brjod do //
translated: Knowing that meditators are intoxicated by drinking the beer of supreme pleasure and are unable to realize it themselves, the ƒÅryas speak to make them understand.

original: ji skad du brjod ce na /üîΩdran pa dang ldan pa dang bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms so zhes de skad du brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad du brjod ce na / dran pa dang ldan pa dang bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms so zhes de skad du brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What do they say?üîΩThey say, ‚ÄúEndowed with mindfulness, abiding in pleasure, equanimity.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gsum po bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i gnas ting nge 'dzin bshad pa yin /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gsum po bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i gnas ting nge 'dzin bshad pa yin /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúafter that, he accomplishes and abides in the third absorption‚Äù explains the concentration that is the basis of both.

original: no ; / bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs shing zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dang / de nyid na dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de gnyis spangs shing ngo //
analyzed: no ; / bde ba yang spangs sdug bsngal yang spangs shing zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dang / de nyid na dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de gnyis spangs shing ngo //
translated: The pleasure of the third absorption and the pain that arises from inhalation and exhalation of the breath in that absorption are both abandoned.

original: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba nyid 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba nyid 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid de /

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba spangs ba'i mjug thogs su sdug bsngal spangs pa la gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde ba spangs ba'i mjug thogs su sdug bsngal spangs pa la gsungs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, immediately after abandoning pleasure, he abandons pain.üîΩAnd he has previously abandoned joy and depression.

original: snga nas yid bde ba dang mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'i sgras dga' ba snga nas nub pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snga nas yid bde ba dang mi bde ba yang nub pas zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'i sgras dga' ba snga nas nub pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word joy indicates that he has previously abandoned joy.

original: dga' ba yang yongs su gyur nas yid mi bde bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir bde ba nub pa'i mjug thogs su yid mi bde ba nub pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' ba yang yongs su gyur nas yid mi bde bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir bde ba nub pa'i mjug thogs su yid mi bde ba nub pa gsungs so //
translated: Joy is transformed into depression. Therefore, immediately after abandoning pleasure, he abandons depression.

original: yid kyi sa pa spangs pa'i phyir sngar thams cad spangs par bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa spangs pa'i phyir sngar thams cad spangs par bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not explained that all are abandoned previously, because the level of the mental faculty is abandoned.

original: gnyi ga spangs pa 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bshad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga spangs pa 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bshad do //
translated: This abandonment of both explains the degeneration of the adverse factors.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sems ston pa ste 'dis ni gnyen po sgom pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sems ston pa ste 'dis ni gnyen po sgom pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúneither suffering nor pleasure‚Äù indicates the mind of the fourth meditative concentration. This explains the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: btang snyoms kyi dran pas yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i phyir btang snyoms su 'jug pa'i dran @58b pa yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dran pas yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i phyir btang snyoms su 'jug pa'i dran @58b pa yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúpurified by the recollection of equanimity‚Äù means that the recollection of the meditative development of equanimity is purified because it is free of agitation.

original: 'dis ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon bshad do //
translated: This explains the benefit of meditative development.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i gnas ting nge 'dzin bshad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i gnas ting nge 'dzin bshad do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving attained the fourth meditative concentration, he remains in it‚Äù explains the meditative absorption that is the basis for both of these.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: He has transcended all perceptions of form means that he has transcended the perceptions associated with eye-consciousness.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba ni rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing zhes bya ba ni rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur pa'o //
translated: The perceptions of obstruction have disappeared means that the perceptions associated with ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness have disappeared.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro
translated: He does not pay attention to the perceptions of multiplicity means that he does not pay attention to the perceptions associated with mind-consciousness, because mind-consciousness is the discriminator.

original: // 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams par bstan to //
analyzed: // 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams par bstan to //
translated: This shows the inferiority of the counteragent.

original: rnam par gzhig pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la bdag med par mthong ba'i phyir gnyen po gang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa de ni gnyen po sgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhig pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la bdag med par mthong ba'i phyir gnyen po gang gis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa de ni gnyen po sgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since one sees the selflessness of objects such as form by the method of thorough analysis, one should understand that the meditation on the antidote is that by which one completely transcends the discriminations of objects such as form.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthinking ‚Äòspace is infinite‚Äô‚Äù is the benefit of meditation.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di nyid gnyen po sgom pa yin par rigs so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di nyid gnyen po sgom pa yin par rigs so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is the meditation on the antidote.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i gnas ting nge 'dzin bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga'i gnas ting nge 'dzin bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving established and abiding in the sphere of infinite space‚Äù explains the concentration that is the abode of both.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di nyid bsgoms pa'i phan yon yang yin la gnas kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di nyid bsgoms pa'i phan yon yang yin la gnas kyang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that this is the benefit of meditation and also the abode.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The other spheres should be understood in the same way, as appropriate.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind endowed with loving-kindness is called ‚Äúvast‚Äù because it accomplishes the happiness of the realm of desire.

original: chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa dga' ba dang bcas pa nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /üîΩde gnyis na dga' ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa dga' ba dang bcas pa nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / de gnyis na dga' ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because it accomplishes the joy of the first and second meditation stages.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúimmeasurable‚Äù because it is applied to an immeasurable number of sentient beings.

original: mi gnyis pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa dga' ba med pa nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa dga' ba med pa nye bar sgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnon-divided‚Äù because it is applied to sentient beings without making distinctions.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its counter-agent?

original: kho na med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kho na med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnon-hatred‚Äù.

original: rnam par dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its purification?

original: @59a * // 'gran zla med pa'i sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @59a * // 'gran zla med pa'i sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnon-obscuration‚Äù because it is the counter-agent to the obscurations of the three vehicles.

original: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its result?

original: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnon-violence‚Äù because it is the counter-agent to violence.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni 'jig rten chos kyi dbyings dam pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa ni 'jig rten chos kyi dbyings dam pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the nature of the ultimate realm of the world‚Äù indicates that this knowledge has the essential nature of the ultimate realm.

original: mtha' yongs su ma chad pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' yongs su ma chad pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving an infinite scope‚Äù indicates that it extends to the limits of the realm of space.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mngon par shes pa las rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar rab tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mngon par shes pa las rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar rab tu mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving a purity that is due to the knowledge of death and rebirth‚Äù indicates that this knowledge is clear and distinct.

original: mi las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rgyang ring po mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rgyang ring po mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving a scope that transcends the human‚Äù indicates that this knowledge has a scope that is far-reaching.

original: yul gzhan dang / 'jig rten gzhan na yod pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan dang / 'jig rten gzhan na yod pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is far-reaching because it perceives what is in other places and in other worlds.

original: re zhig gang gis mthong ba ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang gis mthong ba ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the manner in which this knowledge perceives.

original: gang mthong ba la 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa ni 'chi 'pho pa dang skye ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gang mthong ba la 'chi 'pho ba la sogs pa ni 'chi 'pho pa dang skye ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdeath and rebirth‚Äù indicates the specific forms of death and rebirth.

original: mdog sdug pa dang mdog mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: mdog sdug pa dang mdog mi sdug pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbeautiful and ugly‚Äù indicates the distinction between what is attractive and what is unattractive.

original: bde bar song ba dang ngan par song ba zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang bkren pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bde bar song ba dang ngan par song ba zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug dang bkren pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who go to a good destination and those who go to a bad destination‚Äù are distinguished by their being wealthy or poor.

original: bzang po dang ngan pa zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba dang rgya mi che ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bzang po dang ngan pa zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba dang rgya mi che ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who are good and those who are bad‚Äù are distinguished by their being great or not great.

original: las ji lta ba bzhin nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba ni las kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: las ji lta ba bzhin nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba ni las kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúSentient beings who go according to their actions‚Äù are distinguished by their actions.

original: lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum dang ngo //
analyzed: lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have physical misconduct‚Äù have the three kinds of misconduct such as killing.

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ngo //
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have verbal misconduct‚Äù have the four kinds of verbal misconduct such as lying.

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ba rnab sems la sogs pa rnam pa gsum dang ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ba rnab sems la sogs pa rnam pa gsum dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have mental misconduct‚Äù have the three kinds of mental misconduct such as covetousness.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams med do zhes 'phags pa rnams la skur ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la mi snyan par brjod pa dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams med do zhes 'phags pa rnams la skur ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la mi snyan par brjod pa dag go //
translated: The phrase who reviles the noble ones means those who revile the noble ones by saying, There are no noble ones, and those who speak unpleasantly to the noble ones.

original: log par lta ba can zhes bya ba ni nyes pa bshad ma thag pa dang / dkon mchog dag la ma dad pas so //
analyzed: log par lta ba can zhes bya ba ni nyes pa bshad ma thag pa dang / dkon mchog dag la ma dad pas so //
translated: The phrase who have wrong views means those who have the faults just explained and those who lack faith in the Three Jewels.

original: log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba'i las len pa dang byed pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba'i las len pa dang byed pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase who have taken up the karma of wrong views means those who have taken up and accumulated the karma of wrong views.

original: lus zhig nas zhes bya ba ni shi nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus zhig nas zhes bya ba ni shi nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase when their bodies disintegrate means when they die.

original: shi ba'i 'og tu shi ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu shi ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase after death means immediately after death.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: smras pa / ngan song ngan 'gro rnam par lhung ba'i phyir sems can @59b rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ngan song ngan 'gro rnam par lhung ba'i phyir sems can @59b rnams su skye'o //
translated: It is said, They are born among the sentient beings who have fallen into the lower realms and the evil destinies.

original: cig shos la ni bzlog ste sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos la ni bzlog ste sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be applied to the other case.

original: bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du zhes bya ba la 'gro ba bsngags pa ni bde 'gro'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du zhes bya ba la 'gro ba bsngags pa ni bde 'gro'o //
translated: The world of the happy realms of the higher destinies is praised as a happy realm.

original: yon tan bsngags pa sgrub pa la mtho ris te mtho ris ni 'jig rten yin no //
analyzed: yon tan bsngags pa sgrub pa la mtho ris te mtho ris ni 'jig rten yin no //
translated: The higher realms are praised as having good qualities, and the higher realms are the world.

original: sa 'og ma la dbang byed pa'i dbang byed pa yongs su mi 'dor ba nyams pa med par yongs su ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la dbang byed pa'i dbang byed pa yongs su mi 'dor ba nyams pa med par yongs su ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He shows that he does not abandon his sovereignty over the lower realms, that he is not diminished.

original: gnod pa byed du dogs pa la ni bshes pa nyid du snyan pa'i tshig gis sbyor te bshes shing 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgnod pa byed pa la mi 'khrugs pa ni mi g-yos pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa byed du dogs pa la ni bshes pa nyid du snyan pa'i tshig gis sbyor te bshes shing 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro // gnod pa byed pa la mi 'khrugs pa ni mi g-yos pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He is friendly to those who might harm him, and he is conciliatory with pleasant speech, because he has a friendly and gentle attitude.üîΩHe is not disturbed by those who do harm, because he has an attitude that is unshaken.

original: phyir mi gshe ba la sogs pa ni mi 'khrugs pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi gshe ba la sogs pa ni mi 'khrugs pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He is not disturbed by those who do harm, because he has an attitude that is unshaken.

original: yid mi bde ba mi skyed pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces bya ba yin te de ltar na gnod pa byed pa la bzod pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba mi skyed pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces bya ba yin te de ltar na gnod pa byed pa la bzod pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Not causing mental unhappiness is called the attitude of non-agitation. Thus, there are three kinds of patience with regard to the injurer.

original: 'das pa la nga rgyal med pas ni mtho dman med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la nga rgyal med pas ni mtho dman med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Not being proud about the past is called the attitude of non-highmindedness.

original: gzhan las 'dud pa'i bya ba la mi smon pa ni sems can gyis byas pa la 'dod pa med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las 'dud pa'i bya ba la mi smon pa ni sems can gyis byas pa la 'dod pa med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Not wishing for homage from others is called the attitude of not desiring service from sentient beings.

analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to yang dag par rab tu 'jog go zhes bya ba 'di ni tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i tshig bla dags so //
