original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: tshul bzhin la rab tu brtson pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin la rab tu brtson pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who is intent on what is correct does not engage in sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: sdig pa de dag kyang tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / shes rab kyi mi @63a * //üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: sdig pa de dag kyang tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / shes rab kyi mi @63a * // mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: Those sins are the counteragents to morality, the counteragents to meditative concentration, and the counteragents to wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang 'di'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang 'di'i tshul khrims nyams pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'i rgyu gang dag yin pa tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang yin te /
translated: The counteragents to morality are the degeneration of morality and the other causes of the degeneration of morality that are counteragents to the aggregate of morality.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //üîΩting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o // ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni /
translated: This is called the counteragent to morality.

original: gang 'di kun tu spyod pa nyams pa dang / sems g-yeng ba'i rgyu gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di kun tu spyod pa nyams pa dang / sems g-yeng ba'i rgyu gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang yin te /
translated: The counteragents to meditative concentration are the degeneration of meditative practice and the other causes of the degeneration of meditative concentration.üîΩThe counteragents to wisdom are the degeneration of wisdom and the other causes of the degeneration of wisdom.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äúcounterpart of concentration.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang 'di lta ba nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa'i rgyu gzhan dang ; gzhan dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni gang 'di lta ba nyams pa dang / lta ba nyams pa'i rgyu gzhan dang ; gzhan dag kyang yin te /
translated: The counterpart of wisdom is the degeneration of view, and other causes of the degeneration of view.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‚Äúcounterpart of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de dag ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called ‚Äúevil, unwholesome dharmas.‚Äù

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gang gis de lta bu ma skyes pa de dag skye ba'i go skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni yang dag par spong ba dang po yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gang gis de lta bu ma skyes pa de dag skye ba'i go skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni yang dag par spong ba dang po yin no //
translated: The correct mental attention by which one does not create an opportunity for the arising of those that have not yet arisen is the first right effort.

original: lhag ma ni 'di kho na las rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'di kho na las rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dun pa ni byed par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dun pa ni byed par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with will, endowed with the striving of concentration‚Äù means: will is the desire to act.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Concentration is one-pointedness of mind.

original: 'dun pa'i dbang grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i dbang grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The samadhi of the power of aspiration.üîΩ

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of the faculty of will is the concentration of will.

original: des nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir 'du byed pa de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir 'du byed pa de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with that formative force because it abandons the defilements.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of spiritual power?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
translated: It is the basis of spiritual power.

original: yan lag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yan lag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbasis‚Äù is ‚Äúlimb‚Äù.

original: de sgom mo zhes bya ba ni goms par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de sgom mo zhes bya ba ni goms par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dben pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is cultivated means it is practiced.

original: 'dod pa dang sdig pa mi dge ba las dben pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang sdig pa mi dge ba las dben pa'i phyir ro // 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is based on seclusion means it is associated with the first meditation, because it is secluded from the realm of desire and from evil, unwholesome dharmas.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is based on the absence of desire means it is associated with the second meditation, because it is free from the desire of the realm of desire and from the desire for the first meditation.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de la bral ba zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de la bral ba zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from ill-will and free from restlessness and remorse means it is associated with the third meditation, because it is free from ill-will and so on.üîΩIt is based on equanimity means it is associated with the fourth meditation, because it is free from the gross, medium and subtle categories of the four faults of the third meditation.

original: 'gog pa la gnas pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa la gnas pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is endowed with the third meditative concentration, since he abides in cessation.

original: de dga' pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dga' pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is free from the passion of joy.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de la 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de la 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is cessation, since it is the freedom from passion.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: He is endowed with the fourth meditative concentration, etc.

original: spangs zin pa la ye shes sngon du 'gro bas spong ba'o //
analyzed: spangs zin pa la ye shes sngon du 'gro bas spong ba'o //
translated: He abandons that which has already been abandoned, since knowledge precedes him.

original: spangs zin pa la ye shes sngon du 'gro @63b bas spong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: spangs zin pa la ye shes sngon du 'gro @63b bas spong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that he abandons that which has already been abandoned, since knowledge precedes him.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba spangs pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba spangs pa la /
translated: In the fourth meditative concentration, he abandons pleasure, pain, and mental satisfaction.

original: spangs pa de yang de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa de yang de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That abandonment is not associated with him.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the others, as is appropriate.

original: dad pa ni sems dang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni sems dang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity of mind.

original: dbang byed pas na dbang ngo //
analyzed: dbang byed pas na dbang ngo //
translated: It is a controlling faculty because it controls.

original: yang na dbang yod pas na dbang ngo //
analyzed: yang na dbang yod pas na dbang ngo //
translated: Or else, it is a controlling faculty because it has control.

original: dbang nyid dbang po yin te /
analyzed: dbang nyid dbang po yin te /
translated: The faculties are the very powers.

original: dbang phyug dang ldan pa dang / dbang phyug thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ldan pa dang / dbang phyug thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called powers because they dominate and because they attain lordship.

original: de la dad pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad par byed /
analyzed: de la dad pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad par byed /
translated: Among them, faith causes one to believe in all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni sgrub par byed /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni sgrub par byed /
translated: Vigor causes one to practice.

original: dran pas ni chud mi za bar byed /
analyzed: dran pas ni chud mi za bar byed /
translated: Mindfulness causes one not to lose one's hold on the qualities.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni rtse gcig tu byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis ni rtse gcig tu byed /
translated: Concentration causes one to be one-pointed.

original: shes rab kyis ni so sor rtog par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni so sor rtog par byed de /
translated: Wisdom causes one to discriminate.

original: de ltar na 'di dag rang gi bya ba byed nus pa'i phyir dbang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag rang gi bya ba byed nus pa'i phyir dbang po nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, they are called faculties because they are capable of performing their own functions.

original: de dag nyid dbang po rnon po rgyud la yod pa rnams bdud dang rab tu rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rdzi ba'i phyir stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid dbang po rnon po rgyud la yod pa rnams bdud dang rab tu rgol ba thams cad kyis mi rdzi ba'i phyir stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called powers because they are faculties existing in a series that is sharp and unassailable by any opposing forces.

original: de lta bas na dad pa'i stobs sgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dad pa'i stobs sgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should cultivate the power of faith, etc.‚Äù

original: dag pas na lam mo //
analyzed: dag pas na lam mo //
translated: It is a path because it is pure.

original: yang na 'dis sam 'di yod na dag par 'gyur ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis sam 'di yod na dag par 'gyur ba'i lam ste /
translated: Or, it is a path because one is purified by it or through it.

original: sems rnam par dag pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the means for purifying the mind.

original: de yang bsgom pa'i lam la yan lag brgyad pa yin pas de'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba sgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang bsgom pa'i lam la yan lag brgyad pa yin pas de'i phyir yang dag pa'i lta ba sgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, since it is the eightfold path on the path of cultivation, therefore it is said, ‚Äúone cultivates right view,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di nyid dge ba gsum dang phung po gsum gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di nyid dge ba gsum dang phung po gsum gyis bsdus te /
translated: This very noble eightfold path is included in the three virtues and the three aggregates.

original: dge ba gsum ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba gsum ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams so //
translated: The three virtues are the roots of virtue such as non-greed.

original: phung po gsum ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gsum ni ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three aggregates are concentration and so on.

original: de la ma chags pa ni khams gsum pa la sems mngon par chags pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni khams gsum pa la sems mngon par chags pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, non-greed is the mind not attached to the three realms.

original: 'di gang gi rtsa ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang gi rtsa ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the root of this?

original: de las skyes pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba rnams dang / lam gyi yan lag gsum po yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: de las skyes pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba rnams dang / lam gyi yan lag gsum po yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rtsa ba yin te /
translated: The roots of virtue are the three aggregates of concentration and so on. The three aggregates are the roots of the three path factors: right thought, right effort, and right concentration.

original: 'di rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: These are called the concentration aggregate.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni sems can rnams dang 'du byed rnams la gnod pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni sems can rnams dang 'du byed rnams la gnod pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Non-hatred is the absence of harm toward sentient beings and toward formations.

original: gang gi rtsa ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi rtsa ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is its root?

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i rtsa ba yin te /üîΩ'di rnams ni tshul khrims kyi phung @64a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i rtsa ba yin te / 'di rnams ni tshul khrims kyi phung @64a * //
translated: It is the root of the wholesome actions of body, speech, and mind, namely, right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: po zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: po zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: These are called the morality aggregate.

original: gti mug med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa mthong ba ste /
translated: Non-delusion is the knowledge and vision of things as they really are with regard to the four noble truths.

original: gti mug med pa las skyes pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba dang / lam gyi yan lag gnyis po yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug med pa las skyes pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba dang / lam gyi yan lag gnyis po yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Non-delusion is the root of the wholesome actions of body, speech, and mind, and of two of the branches of the path, namely, right view and right mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa na /
translated: When one cultivates the noble eightfold path,

original: lus yongs su sgom pa yin te /
analyzed: lus yongs su sgom pa yin te /
translated: He cultivates the body,

original: yan lag gnyis po yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag gnyis po yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cultivates the two members of right action and right effort.

original: tshul khrims bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He cultivates morality,

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cultivates right speech and right livelihood.

original: sems bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He cultivates the mind,

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cultivates right thought and right concentration.üîΩHe cultivates wisdom,

original: shes rab bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he cultivates right view and right mindfulness.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos ni rtogs ba myur ba dang / rtogs pa dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung pos ni rtogs ba myur ba dang / rtogs pa dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the aggregate of morality and the aggregate of concentration, he has quick understanding and pure understanding.

original: shes rab kyi phung pos ni rtogs pa chen po dang / rtogs pa rgya che ba dang / ma lus pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung pos ni rtogs pa chen po dang / rtogs pa rgya che ba dang / ma lus pa rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By the aggregate of wisdom, he has great understanding, extensive understanding, and complete understanding.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom pa na /
translated: Thus, when one cultivates the eightfold noble path,

original: rtogs pa rnam pa lnga thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rtogs pa rnam pa lnga thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: one obtains the five realizations.

original: / de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sgom pa dben ba la sogs pa yon tan bzhi dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sgom pa dben ba la sogs pa yon tan bzhi dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is endowed with four qualities, such as being free from defilements.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis su brjod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis su brjod de /
translated: The result is described in two ways:

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: the characteristic of the abandonment of the defilement-related and action-related defilements.

original: / de'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par sgrub pa de nyid kyi thabs gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: / de'i thabs kyi dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon par sgrub pa de nyid kyi thabs gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: With regard to the means for that, means for the purification of the field and for the accomplishment of the Buddha qualities,

original: sa la chog par mi 'dzin par sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa bdun pa'i bar bsdus te /
analyzed: sa la chog par mi 'dzin par sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa bdun pa'i bar bsdus te /
translated: The establishment of the lack of complacency with the stages refers to up to the seventh stage.

original: gong nas gong du khyad par can gyi chos yongs su tshol ba nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gong nas gong du khyad par can gyi chos yongs su tshol ba nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: The special qualities are taught by the thorough search for the Dharma which is ever more excellent.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni brgyad pa ste //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni brgyad pa ste //
translated: The stage of nonregression is the eighth,

original: der sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains the profound liberation of the qualities of a Buddha on that stage.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sgrub pas ni sa dgu pa dang bcu pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sgrub pas ni sa dgu pa dang bcu pa bstan te /
translated: The accomplishment of the evolutionary development of beings is taught by the ninth and tenth stages,

original: de gnyis ni thabs la mkhas pa chen @64b pos rnam par dpyod pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang thams cad kyi gsang ba rtogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni thabs la mkhas pa chen @64b pos rnam par dpyod pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang thams cad kyi gsang ba rtogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because on those two stages one attains the analytical knowledges and the realization of all the secrets by great skill in means.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni gsum dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni gsum dang sbyar te /
translated: The three kinds of grasping are to be connected with the three stages.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: so sor rtog pa'i phyir na rtag par 'dzin pa rnams so //üîΩbdag nyid du khas len pa'i phyir na bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i phyir na rtag par 'dzin pa rnams so // bdag nyid du khas len pa'i phyir na bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: The grasping of permanence is due to discrimination.üîΩThe grasping of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is due to the claim of ownership.

original: nor bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir na nor du 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: nor bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir na nor du 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: The grasping of wealth is due to the grasping of possessions as one‚Äôs wealth.

original: nyes dmigs ni rten gyi gnas so //
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni rten gyi gnas so //
translated: The disadvantage is the basis of the support.

original: ston pa la gus pa ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams sangs rgyas kyis smad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa la gus pa ni bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams sangs rgyas kyis smad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Respect for the teacher is because the proscribed misdeeds are condemned by the Buddha.

original: kha na ma tho bas 'jigs pa ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas 'jigs pa ni rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: Fear of misdeeds is because the naturally misdeeds are associated with the defilements.

original: /'di gnyis kyis ni bya ba'i cha ma yin pa nyid kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: /'di gnyis kyis ni bya ba'i cha ma yin pa nyid kho nar bstan to //
translated: These two show that one should not do what is not to be done.

original: bya bar 'os pa nyid kyang rgyu gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: bya bar 'os pa nyid kyang rgyu gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: One should do what is to be done, and this is shown by two causes:

original: ston pas bsngags pa dang / tshogs dang mthun pas so //
analyzed: ston pas bsngags pa dang / tshogs dang mthun pas so //
translated: praise by the teacher and by the assembly.

original: 'jam pa'i sems nyid de yang rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i sems nyid de yang rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The mind of gentleness is also shown by three causes, etc.

original: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The special quality of comfort is

original: mnyen pa'i sems zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyen pa'i sems zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: what is called the mind of gentleness.üîΩThe special quality of mastery of concentration is

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i khyad par ni las su rung ba'i sems gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'i khyad par ni las su rung ba'i sems gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: what is called the serviceable mind.

original: nyes pa rnam par 'bri ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par ni phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa'i sems zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam par 'bri ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par ni phan pa dang bde ba bskyed pa'i sems zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The special antidote that eliminates faults is called the mind that generates benefit and happiness.

original: nyes pa rnam par 'bri ba yang tshig 'dis sbyor ba bstan pa yin pas tshig 'dis ni yan lag yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam par 'bri ba yang tshig 'dis sbyor ba bstan pa yin pas tshig 'dis ni yan lag yin no //
translated: Since the elimination of faults is taught by this statement, this is the limb.

original: tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni nyes pa rnams rnam pa drug tu phye nas 'di nyid rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni nyes pa rnams rnam pa drug tu phye nas 'di nyid rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: The remaining statements analyze this very [antidote] by dividing the faults into six types.

original: de la chos ston pa'i dus na zang zing dang bcas pa la nyon mongs pa 'am klan ka tshol ba la nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos ston pa'i dus na zang zing dang bcas pa la nyon mongs pa 'am klan ka tshol ba la nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Among them, when teaching the Dharma, there is the affliction of seeking material things, and the affliction of seeking to find fault.

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The word or indicates inclusion.

original: nyes pa 'di gnyis kyi gnyen por yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di gnyis kyi gnyen por yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems zhes gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to these two faults is called the completely unafflicted mind.

original: zang zing rab tu sbyin pa dag dang / klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pas yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing rab tu sbyin pa dag dang / klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa dag la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba med pas yongs su nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not defiled by attachment to or aversion to the giving of material things and the seeking of faults.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / ye shes kyis chog par 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang / ye shes kyis chog par 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste /
translated: The faults of generosity, etc., and the virtues of fewness of wishes, etc., are the contentment with knowledge.

original: de'i gnyen por tshig gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por tshig gnyis te /
translated: The two phrases are the antidotes to those.

original: gong nas gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: gong nas gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
translated: One has a mind that seeks ever higher distinctions.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par mngon par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin @65a * //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par mngon par 'dod pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin @65a * // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: One has a mind that desires the distinction of knowledge.

original: skyo ba ni nyes pa ste de'i gnyen por 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i sems zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: skyo ba ni nyes pa ste de'i gnyen por 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i sems zhes gsungs te /
translated: Discouragement is a fault. The antidote to that is the thought of protecting all beings.

original: sems can gyi don du yun ring por dka' ba mang po khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du yun ring por dka' ba mang po khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has accepted for a long time the many hardships for the sake of sentient beings.

original: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste de'i gnyen por bla ma la gus pa dang mthun pa'i sems zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nyes pa ste de'i gnyen por bla ma la gus pa dang mthun pa'i sems zhes gsungs te /
translated: The fault of holding one's own view as supreme is remedied by the attitude of respect for the guru and by the attitude of accord.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i chos spyad pa'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbyas pa gzo ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag ste /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i chos spyad pa'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa'i phyir ro // byas pa gzo ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag ste /
translated: The attitude of accord is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.

original: de la phan gdags par yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phan gdags par yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The branch of gratitude is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.

original: byas pa shes pa'i phyir byas pa tshor ba'o //üîΩsems rjes su srung ba'i phyir des pa'o //üîΩji skad rjes su bstan pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'grogs na bde ba'o //üîΩnyes pa gling ba bzod pa'i phyir drang ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa shes pa'i phyir byas pa tshor ba'o // sems rjes su srung ba'i phyir des pa'o // ji skad rjes su bstan pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'grogs na bde ba'o // nyes pa gling ba bzod pa'i phyir drang ba'o //
translated: The branch of grateful recognition is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.üîΩThe branch of gentleness is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.

original: dris pas 'khrug pa bzod pa ni mnyen pa'o //
analyzed: dris pas 'khrug pa bzod pa ni mnyen pa'o //
translated: The branch of amiability is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.üîΩThe branch of straightforwardness is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.

original: rang gi nyes pa mi 'chab pas ni thibs po med par spyod pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan mi brjod pas na sgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa mi 'chab pas ni thibs po med par spyod pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan mi brjod pas na sgyu med pa'o //
translated: The branch of non-dissimulation is the attitude of a bodhisattva who is engaged in the practice of the teaching in accordance with the teaching.

original: khengs par mi 'gyur bas na nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: khengs par mi 'gyur bas na nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: It is without pride, since it is not puffed up.

original: tshig bzod pas na bka' blo bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshig bzod pas na bka' blo bde ba'o //
translated: It is agreeable, since it is patient with the words of others.

original: ma nor bar 'dzin pas na mthun par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ma nor bar 'dzin pas na mthun par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is receptive, since it holds the Dharma without error.

original: de'i 'bras bu gong ma dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu gong ma dang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ngo //
translated: Its result is the above, i.e., the characteristic of the abandonment of the defilement-obstruction.

original: de'i 'bras bu 'og ma rnams dang zhes bya ba ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu 'og ma rnams dang zhes bya ba ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang ste /
translated: Its result is the below, i.e., the characteristic of the abandonment of the action-obstruction, etc.

original: de dag ni dul ba dang zhi bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dul ba dang zhi bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are distinguished by their discipline and peace.

original: mdor na 'di'i 'bras bu ni de sngon 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa /
analyzed: mdor na 'di'i 'bras bu ni de sngon 'gro ba'i khams brtas pa /
translated: In brief, its result is the growth of the element that preceded it.

original: bsam pa'i khams ni 'di byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khams ni 'di byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The element of intention is the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub de'i lam gang yin pa de sgrub pa'i phyir thob pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams so //
analyzed: byang chub de'i lam gang yin pa de sgrub pa'i phyir thob pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams so //
translated: The element of superior intention is the path to enlightenment, since it is the means of attaining and realizing it.

original: nges pa skye ba ni mos pa ste nges pa shin tu gsal ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnyen po 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa skye ba ni mos pa ste nges pa shin tu gsal ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i gnyen po 'phel ba yin no //
translated: The arising of certainty is interest, which is the increase of the antidote that arises from the cause of very clear certainty.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / 'jig rten pa ni dri ma'i nag nog dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / 'jig rten pa ni dri ma'i nag nog dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The decrease of the counteragent of all roots of virtue and the freedom from the stains of the mundane are purity.

original: sa de'i gsang ba la the tshom za ba ldog pa ni 'di'i the tshom dang yid gnyis dang nem nur yang rgyun chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa de'i gsang ba la the tshom za ba ldog pa ni 'di'i the tshom dang yid gnyis dang nem nur yang rgyun chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of doubt about the secrets of this stage is the cessation of his doubts, hesitations, and uncertainties.

original: de log na ste the tshom gyi gnas gzhan dag la yang mos te /
analyzed: de log na ste the tshom gyi gnas gzhan dag la yang mos te /
translated: When that is reversed, one has interest in other objects of doubt.

original: nges pa 'thob pa ni som nyi med pa mngon du @65b 'gyur ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa 'thob pa ni som nyi med pa mngon du @65b 'gyur ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The attainment of certainty is the completion of the manifestation of the absence of doubt.

original: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa yang yang dag par 'grub po zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa'i khyad par ni dga' ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa yang yang dag par 'grub po zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The special state of ease is the accomplishment of joy and pliancy.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed nus pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed nus pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ability to bring beings to full maturity is called the transformative power of the Tathagata.

original: ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa mngon par sgrub pa ni sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa mngon par sgrub pa ni sems kyi bsam pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The accomplishment of immeasurable concentrations is called the immeasurable mental states.

original: sems zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ting nge 'dzin rnams bstan to //üîΩde ltar na gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba 'di'i 'bras bu bcu tshan bzhis rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sngar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis bshad pa dang /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ting nge 'dzin rnams bstan to // de ltar na gnyen po sgom pa 'phel ba 'di'i 'bras bu bcu tshan bzhis rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sngar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis bshad pa dang /
translated: The word mind indicates the training of higher thought, the concentrations.üîΩThus, the fourfold teaching of the four kinds of results of the increase of the cultivation of the counteragent is completed.

original: spyir na de'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: spyir na de'i 'bras bu /
translated: The two kinds of results previously explained, the results of disjunction and of human effort, are the general results of the counteragent.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa drug gis rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa drug gis rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
translated: The other four kinds of results are the specific results.

original: mchod pa la sogs lhag ma kun //üîΩ'od byed ji ltar de bzhin du //
analyzed: mchod pa la sogs lhag ma kun // 'od byed ji ltar de bzhin du //
translated: The remaining results of worship and so onüîΩare like the radiant,

original: 'od 'phro can la'ang shes par bya //
analyzed: 'od 'phro can la'ang shes par bya //
translated: and should be understood as the radiant.

original: khyad par du na yon tan lhag / yongs su dag pa de'i sa pa de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du na yon tan lhag / yongs su dag pa de'i sa pa de las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In particular, it is superior in terms of its qualities, because it is equal to the bodhisattvas of the pure levels.

original: thos stsogs shes pa rab brten nas //
analyzed: thos stsogs shes pa rab brten nas //
translated: Having well relied on the knowledge of hearing and so on,

original: 'od byed pa la snang byas te //
analyzed: 'od byed pa la snang byas te //
translated: having made light on the illuminating,

original: gti mug mun pa rnam mnan nas //
analyzed: gti mug mun pa rnam mnan nas //
translated: having overcome the darkness of delusion,

original: de 'og 'od 'phro can rnam sbyong //
analyzed: de 'og 'od 'phro can rnam sbyong //
translated: after that, one purifies the radiant.

original: ye shes me ni rab 'bar ba //
analyzed: ye shes me ni rab 'bar ba //
translated: The fire of wisdom is fully blazing,

original: nyon mongs bud shing rnam 'joms pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs bud shing rnam 'joms pa //
translated: having conquered the fuel of the afflictions,

original: chos kyi dbyings ni snang byed pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni snang byed pa //
translated: illuminating the dharmadhatu,

original: thabs dang ye shes ldan pa yis //
analyzed: thabs dang ye shes ldan pa yis //
translated: endowed with method and wisdom,

original: 'bras bu rnam pa drug thob nas //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa drug thob nas //
translated: having attained the six types of results,

original: rnam dag shin tu rnam dag mthong //
analyzed: rnam dag shin tu rnam dag mthong //
translated: one sees the pure and extremely pure.

original: don sgrub par ni dka' ba yi //
analyzed: don sgrub par ni dka' ba yi //
translated: Having accomplished the meaning, which is difficult to accomplish,

original: sa ni shin tu sbyang dka' thob //
analyzed: sa ni shin tu sbyang dka' thob //
translated: one attains the level that is difficult to purify.

original: sngar ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsum pa la de nor che bar 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos rtogs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang yin pa de'i gnyen por bzhi po las lhag par g-yo ba la sogs pa spangs pa gsungs pa
analyzed: sngar ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsum pa la de nor che bar 'dzin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos rtogs pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang yin pa de'i gnyen por bzhi po las lhag par g-yo ba la sogs pa spangs pa gsungs pa
translated: The third is taught in the verse beginning with ‚Äúpreviously,‚Äù and the fourth is taught in the verse beginning with ‚Äúnow.‚Äù

original: / da ni rnam par dag pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen por bshad pa yin no //üîΩde la rnam par dag pa la //
analyzed: / da ni rnam par dag pa la sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen por bshad pa yin no // de la rnam par dag pa la //
translated: Now, in order to counteract the pride of thinking that the causes of the purity of the Buddha and so on are different, it is explained as follows.

original: sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid //
translated: In that regard, the equality of the mind‚Äôs intentionüîΩis in the purity of the bodhisattva.

original: ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi bsam pa gang dag yin pa de dag mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi bsam pa gang dag yin pa de dag mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The equality of the mind‚Äôs intention of the bodhisattvas is in the purity.

original: gang la zhe na rnam par dag pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na rnam par dag pa la'o //
translated: In what? In the purity.

original: 'di skad du sa 'di la byang chub @66a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du sa 'di la byang chub @66a * //
translated: This is what is being said: on this ground, the bodhisattvas‚Äô mind‚Äôs intention is equal in the purity of the Buddha and so on.

original: sems dpa' rnam par dag pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa rnams la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' rnam par dag pa la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa rnams la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The equality of the mental disposition of the bodhisattvas who are endowed with the purity of the Buddha qualities is explained as the purity of the bodhisattvas.

original: tshig mang por bstan pa ni yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig mang por bstan pa ni yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching in many words is due to the difference of the objects.

original: rnam par dag pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The equality of the mental disposition in regard to the purity of the Buddha qualities is explained as the purity of the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rab tu phye nas 'dir rnam pa bcur bstan la de dag la mnyam pa nyid 'thob pas de yang rnam pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rab tu phye nas 'dir rnam pa bcur bstan la de dag la mnyam pa nyid 'thob pas de yang rnam pa bcu yin no //
translated: Moreover, these are taught here as being of ten kinds, distinguished according to the difference of cause and result. And since the equality of the mental disposition is attained in regard to them, it is also of ten kinds.

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos rnams kyang rgyur gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur ba dag go //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos rnams kyang rgyur gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur ba dag go //
translated: The pure dharmas are both causal and resultant.

original: rnam par dag pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams ston te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gang dag yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa rnams ston te /
translated: The purity which is taught as the result is the purity of the Buddha qualities.

original: mdo'i tshig gsum po 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bstan to //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig gsum po 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bstan to //
translated: The three words of the verse are taught according to the difference of the past, etc.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi chos rnam par dag pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams kyi chos rnam par dag pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The purification of the Dharma of the past, future, and present is the characteristic of the powers, fearlessnesses, etc.

original: chos rnam par dag pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid de bsam pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnam par dag pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'di'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid de bsam pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: In that purification of the Dharma, the bodhisattva on the fifth stage has the same thought as the bodhisattvas who have entered the other stages.

original: bsam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thought?

original: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the characteristic of faith, aspiration, effort, and means.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po de dag ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir bsam pa zhes bya ba ste chu'i gzhi bzhin no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po de dag ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir bsam pa zhes bya ba ste chu'i gzhi bzhin no //
translated: Those four dharmas beginning with faith are called thought because they are the basis of all good dharmas, like the basis of water.

original: bsam pa de mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsam pa de mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: That thought is the same.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa 'jug pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa ni mnyam pa nyid 'dis
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa 'jug pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa ni mnyam pa nyid 'dis
translated: Just as the bodhisattva engages the purity of the Dharma of past buddhas with his intention, in the same way he engages the purity of the Dharma of future and present Bhagavans with his intention, with this sameness.

original: 'jug ste / de dag gi rgyud tha dad pa med par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jug ste / de dag gi rgyud tha dad pa med par rtogs so //
translated: He realizes that their continuums are not different.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa thob par bya ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di tshul khrims la sogs pa ste / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa thob par bya ba gang yin pa de /
translated: Just as means morality, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i lam gyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i lam gyis 'thob bo //
translated: The purity of the Dharma of past, future, and present buddhas is to be attained by the bodhisattvas through the path of pure morality, etc.

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de la /
translated: Therefore, in that pure morality,

original: lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lam de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams dang lhan cig bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lam de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams dang lhan cig bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in the path is equal in intention to other bodhisattvas who are established in that path.

original: ji ltar @66b tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ltar sems rnam par dag pa la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar @66b tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ltar sems rnam par dag pa la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as he is equal in intention with regard to the purity of morality, so also is he with regard to the purity of mind.

original: rnam par dag pa bdun po'i bar thams cad la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bdun po'i bar thams cad la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: He is equal in intention with regard to all seven purities.

original: de la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sdom pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sdom pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the purity of morality is the purity of the bodhisattvas morality of restraint, etc.

original: sems rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa ste //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa ste //
translated: The purity of mind is the bodhisattvas purity of concentration.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gnyis tshig gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa gnyis tshig gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The two trainings in higher morality and higher mind are indicated by the first two phrases.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni tshig bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni tshig bzhis bstan te /
translated: The training in higher wisdom is indicated by the last four phrases.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams sel ba dang / som nyi dang yid gnyis rnams sel ba dang / 'gyod pa sel bas rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams sel ba dang / som nyi dang yid gnyis rnams sel ba dang / 'gyod pa sel bas rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called pure because it eliminates views, eliminates doubts and uncertainties, and eliminates regrets.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams sel ba ni lta ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams sel ba ni lta ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It eliminates views because it abandons all views.

original: ji ltar yin snyam pa ni som nyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yin snyam pa ni som nyi'o //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty about how something is.

original: blo sna tshogs pa ni yid gnyis te ji 'di ltar yin nam 'on te de lta ma yin snyam pa'o //
analyzed: blo sna tshogs pa ni yid gnyis te ji 'di ltar yin nam 'on te de lta ma yin snyam pa'o //
translated: Uncertainty is a variety of opinions, such as ‚ÄúIs it like this or is it like that?‚Äù

original: ngan par byas pa dang / yid la gcags pa dang / snying la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngan par byas pa dang / yid la gcags pa dang / snying la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Regret is remorse and sorrow over bad actions.

original: lta ba dang som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa 'di dag sel ba ni rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba dang som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang 'gyod pa 'di dag sel ba ni rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The elimination of these views, doubts, uncertainties, and regrets is purity.

original: rnam par dag pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: In that purity, the bodhisattva‚Äôs intention is equanimity.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa rnam par dag pa nyid la /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa rnam par dag pa nyid la /
translated: In the purity of the knowledge of the path and the nonpath, the intention is purity.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes zhes bya ba ni shes pa gang gis shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lam dang / lam ma yin pa de dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes zhes bya ba ni shes pa gang gis shes rab dang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i lam dang / lam ma yin pa de dang bral ba'am /
translated: Knowledge of the path and not the path is the knowledge by which one knows the path that is embraced by wisdom and means, and the not path that is devoid of them.

original: 'jig rten pa'am theg pa dman par lhung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'am theg pa dman par lhung ba shes pa'o //
translated: Or it is the knowledge of falling into the mundane or the lower vehicle.

original: de ni lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: That is the purity of knowledge of the path and not the path.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, the bodhisattvas attitude is one of sameness.

original: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nas lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa'i bar sngar bshad pa rnams lam bzhi'i nang du bsdoms nas shes pa ni lam
analyzed: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nas lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa'i bar sngar bshad pa rnams lam bzhi'i nang du bsdoms nas shes pa ni lam
translated: The purity of knowledge of the path is called the attitude of sameness because the above mentioned purity of morality up to the purity of knowledge of the path and not the path are combined into the four paths.

original: shes pa'o // lam bzhi ni lam dka' la mngon par shes pa bul ba dang / lam dka' la mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / lam sla la mngon par shes pa bul ba dang / lam sla la mngon par shes @67a * //üîΩpa myur ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'o // lam bzhi ni lam dka' la mngon par shes pa bul ba dang / lam dka' la mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / lam sla la mngon par shes pa bul ba dang / lam sla la mngon par shes @67a * // pa myur ba'o //
translated: The four paths are: the difficult path with slow higher knowledge, the difficult path with quick higher knowledge, the easy path with slow higher knowledge, and the easy path with quick higher knowledge.

original: lam shes pa 'di bzhi rnam par dag pa ni lam shes pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: lam shes pa 'di bzhi rnam par dag pa ni lam shes pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purification of these four knowledges of the path is the purification of the knowledge of the path.

original: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam shes pa rnam par dag pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: In this purification of the knowledge of the path lies the bodhisattva's sameness of intention.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni /üîΩthabs de dag gis sems can khams dang mos pa dang / dbang po tha dad pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa ni / thabs de dag gis sems can khams dang mos pa dang / dbang po tha dad pa /
translated: Maturing sentient beingsüîΩthrough those methods, the bodhisattvas bring to full maturity those sentient beings who are of different dispositions, aspirations, and faculties,

original: thabs sna tshogs pas sgrub par byed pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs sna tshogs pas sgrub par byed pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: and who are to be guided by various methods.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: The purification of that

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: is the purification of the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sa mtshungs pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa gzhan dag dang / lhan cig bsam pa /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sa mtshungs pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa gzhan dag dang / lhan cig bsam pa /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva who is on the same stage as another bodhisattva, together with that other bodhisattva,

original: bsam pa sna tshogs pa ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bsam pa sna tshogs pa ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: has the same intention.

original: tha ma 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bshad do //
analyzed: tha ma 'dis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa bshad do //
translated: The last of these shows the development of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu bo 'di dag gis rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i don du sgrub ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu bo 'di dag gis rgyud tha dad pa ma yin pa'i don du sgrub ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is pure in these ten kinds of mental attitudes of sameness of mind,

original: sa lnga pas rgyud mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa lnga pas rgyud mnyam pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: on the fifth stage, realizes the sameness of mental streams.

original: lam gyis spong ba ste /
analyzed: lam gyis spong ba ste /
translated: The path is the relinquishing.

original: lam gyis spong bar shes pa ni /
analyzed: lam gyis spong bar shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge that the path is the relinquishing

original: lam ni spong bar shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam ni spong bar shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the knowledge that the path is the relinquishing.

original: 'og ma rnam par 'jig pa nyid kyis yid tsam spong ba'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: 'og ma rnam par 'jig pa nyid kyis yid tsam spong ba'i don du bstan to //
translated: The lower ones are taught for the sake of the relinquishing of mere mind through the realization of its disintegration.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam par 'jig pa de la dman pa nyid du rtogs pas /
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa de la dman pa nyid du rtogs pas /
translated: Through the realization of its inferiority in that disintegration.

original: gong ma gong ma gya nom ba don du gnyer ba chog mi shes pa des yid tsam spong ba'i don du bstan to //
analyzed: gong ma gong ma gya nom ba don du gnyer ba chog mi shes pa des yid tsam spong ba'i don du bstan to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúabandoning a little‚Äù is taught for the purpose of abandoning just a little, with the insatiable desire for the ever more sublime.

original: cung zad spong ba ni yid tsam spong ba ste dper na cung zad sgyur ba la yid tsam sgyur ba zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: cung zad spong ba ni yid tsam spong ba ste dper na cung zad sgyur ba la yid tsam sgyur ba zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Abandoning a little is abandoning just a little, just as ‚Äúchanging a little‚Äù is called ‚Äúchanging just a little.‚Äù

original: cung zad spong ba ni gong ma ma yin pa spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: cung zad spong ba ni gong ma ma yin pa spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Abandoning a little is synonymous with ‚Äúabandoning what is not the highest.‚Äù

original: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is uncontaminated.

original: cung zad spong ba yang de la mngon par mi brtson pa las shes par bya ste gong ma don du gnyer bas so //
analyzed: cung zad spong ba yang de la mngon par mi brtson pa las shes par bya ste gong ma don du gnyer bas so //
translated: Abandoning a little should be understood as not striving for that, because of striving for the highest.

original: yid tsam spong ba nyid don yin pas yid tsam spong ba'i don to //
analyzed: yid tsam spong ba nyid don yin pas yid tsam spong ba'i don to //
translated: Since the meaning is just abandoning a little, it has the meaning of abandoning just a little.

original: de'i nga rgyal kun tu gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa la rgyud tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal kun tu gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal kun tu gzhom pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa la rgyud tha dad pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal kun tu gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to completely conquer pride in that, means in order to completely conquer pride in the different continuums of purification.

original: rgyu brgyad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu brgyad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The eight causes, etc.,

original: de la byang chub kyi sems goms par byas pa ni smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems goms par byas pa ni smon lam gyi stobs bskyed pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, having cultivated the thought of awakening is stated because of generating the power of aspirational prayer.

original: theg pa las mi g-yo ba ni snying rje dang byams @67b pas sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa las mi g-yo ba ni snying rje dang byams @67b pas sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Not wavering from the vehicle is stated because of not abandoning any sentient being through compassion and love.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bstsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs bstsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The power of the roots of virtue is stated because of accumulating the collection of merit.

original: brtson pa ma bor ba ni rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brtson pa ma bor ba ni rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Not abandoning striving is stated because of not interrupting.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba ni thabs la mkhas pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba ni thabs la mkhas pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Correct application is stated because of accomplishing skill in means.

original: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni sa gong ma gong ma'i snang ba la lta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni sa gong ma gong ma'i snang ba la lta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Not being satisfied is stated because of seeing the higher and higher appearances.

original: mthu'i khyad par bla thabs thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthu'i khyad par bla thabs thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The special attainment of power is due to the perfect acceptance of the Buddha's blessing.

original: so sor rang gi mthu'i khyad par thob pa ni dran pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: so sor rang gi mthu'i khyad par thob pa ni dran pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The special attainment of individual power is due to wisdom distinguished by mindfulness and so on.

original: de ltar re zhig nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig nga rgyal gyi khyad par gyi gnyen po rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the antidotes to the special kinds of pride should be understood as being arranged in this way.

original: bden pa'i chos nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩ'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bden pa'i chos nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na / 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: How is the reality of the truths arranged?üîΩIt is said: One knows perfectly as it is that 'this is the noble truth of suffering.'

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: It is said: One knows perfectly as it is that 'this is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.'

original: gnyis gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid dag 'jug pa 'di ni bden pa rnams kyi chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nyid dag 'jug pa 'di ni bden pa rnams kyi chos nyid yin no //
translated: The two truths are the nature of the four noble truths.

original: 'di dag byed pa po la mi ltos par ji skad bshad pa'i chos nyid yongs su mi 'dor bas na bden pa nyid do //üîΩgdul bya rnams ni rnam grol ba'i //
analyzed: 'di dag byed pa po la mi ltos par ji skad bshad pa'i chos nyid yongs su mi 'dor bas na bden pa nyid do // gdul bya rnams ni rnam grol ba'i //
translated: They are called truths because they do not abandon the nature that has been explained, without depending on an agent.üîΩThe method of liberation

original: thabs kyi cho ga mdor bsdu na //üîΩtheg dman theg pa mchog dag gis //
analyzed: thabs kyi cho ga mdor bsdu na // theg dman theg pa mchog dag gis //
translated: is summarized in six characteristics.

original: bstan pa rnam pa gnyis kho na //
analyzed: bstan pa rnam pa gnyis kho na //
translated: The teaching is twofold:

original: theg pa dman la gdul bya ba //
analyzed: theg pa dman la gdul bya ba //
translated: the lesser vehicle and the supreme vehicle.

original: yongs smin bya stsogs mtshan nyid drug / theg pa che la gdul bya ba //
analyzed: yongs smin bya stsogs mtshan nyid drug / theg pa che la gdul bya ba //
translated: The characteristics of the six kinds of disciplesüîΩare fully matured and so forth.üîΩThe characteristics of the one disciple of the great vehicle

original: bdun pa yin par yongs su bsgrags //
analyzed: bdun pa yin par yongs su bsgrags //
translated: are fully proclaimed to be seven.

original: de la gdul bar bya drug ni //
analyzed: de la gdul bar bya drug ni //
translated: The six kinds of disciples are

original: yongs smin bya dang de bzhin smin //
analyzed: yongs smin bya dang de bzhin smin //
translated: those to be fully matured, those to be matured,

original: chos nyid dang ni dgongs pa ste //
analyzed: chos nyid dang ni dgongs pa ste //
translated: those who have the nature of the Dharma, and those who have the intention,üîΩthose who are confused about those two,

original: de gnyis la ni kun rmongs dang // de bzhin gzhan yang yang dag pa'i //
analyzed: de gnyis la ni kun rmongs dang // de bzhin gzhan yang yang dag pa'i //
translated: and those who are confused about the perfect.üîΩThe one disciple of the great vehicle

original: yid byed lta dang mi ldan pa //
analyzed: yid byed lta dang mi ldan pa //
translated: is the one who has the perfect mental activity but not the view.

original: 'di drug nyan thos dag tu bshad //
analyzed: 'di drug nyan thos dag tu bshad //
translated: These six are explained as the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle.

original: lnga yi bya ba bden pa la //
analyzed: lnga yi bya ba bden pa la //
translated: The five activities are in the truthüîΩof the wise one.

original: mkhas pa lnga po dag gis bsgrub //
