analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga dang spu bas dang phris yog pa zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyug ma ste tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúCovered by the eggshell of ignorance, wrapped in the membrane of ignorance, and smeared with the unguent of ignorance‚Äù means being endowed with the two innate enemies of proper mental attention, namely, improper mental attention and the two obscurations.

original: mun pas zil gyis gnon pa de dag gi don du zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs glo bur ba dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: mun pas zil gyis gnon pa de dag gi don du zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs glo bur ba dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúOppressed by darkness‚Äù means being endowed with the adventitious enemies of right view, namely, listening to what is not the holy Dharma.

original: lhag ma ni khong du chud par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni khong du chud par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: thos pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni tshig gsum gyis dran pa dang ldan pa dang / blo gros dang ldan pa dang rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba shes rab gsum bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni tshig gsum gyis dran pa dang ldan pa dang / blo gros dang ldan pa dang rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba shes rab gsum bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in the retention of what is heard is indicated by the three words: endowed with mindfulness, endowed with intelligence, and endowed with realization.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum po 'di nyid rnam par bshad pa gzhan gyis don tha dad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum po 'di nyid rnam par bshad pa gzhan gyis don tha dad par ston pa'o //
translated: Another enumeration is indicated by the three words, which are explained in another way, with a different meaning.

original: de la thos pa 'dzin pa ni dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la thos pa 'dzin pa ni dran pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the retention of what is heard is called endowed with mindfulness.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig kyang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa ni chos nyid zab mo ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig kyang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa tha dad pa ni chos nyid zab mo ste /
translated: The profound reality is the difference in the general and specific characteristics, etc., of the single taste of emptiness.

original: de shes pa ni blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni blo gros dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is called endowed with intelligence.

original: dgongs pa zab mo shes pa ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo shes pa ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The knowledge of the profound intention is called endowed with realization.

original: do rnams kyi tshul ni lugs te /
analyzed: do rnams kyi tshul ni lugs te /
translated: The way of those is the system.

original: de'i dgongs pa mngon du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa mngon du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realization of that intention.

original: dang pos ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dang pos ni mdo la sogs pa'i chos la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The first line shows skill in the Dharma of the sutras, etc.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni don la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni don la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The remaining lines show skill in the meaning.

original: ngo tsha dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni sdom pa blangs pa bsrungs pas bzod pa dang nges pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims mnos pa 'dral bar mi byed do ;
analyzed: ngo tsha dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni sdom pa blangs pa bsrungs pas bzod pa dang nges pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims mnos pa 'dral bar mi byed do ;
translated: By means of shame, one protects the vow of morality that one has taken, and because of patience and certainty, one does not violate the morality that one has undertaken.

original: / brten pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su mi 'dor te /
analyzed: / brten pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su mi 'dor te /
translated: By means of firmness, one does not abandon morality in any way.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims mnyam pa dang / skyon med pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims mnyam pa dang / skyon med pa yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the equality of morality and the absence of error are shown.

original: blo dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes so //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba shes so //
translated: By means of intelligence, one understands dependent origination.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par lta ba'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par lta ba'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù is the antidote to the view of causelessness.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba rgyur lta ba'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba rgyur lta ba'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúFrom the birth of this, that is born‚Äù is the antidote to the view of an irregular cause.

original: mi rtag pa'i rgyu rtag pa ni rgyu mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rgyu rtag pa ni rgyu mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: An eternal cause of the impermanent is an irregular cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who knows the possible and the impossible.

original: rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he knows the cause and the non-cause.

original: rtogs pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis @70a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis @70a * //
translated: Because he possesses the knowledge of realization,

original: ni bdud phyir rgol ba la sogs pa gzhan dag gis mi bkri zhing mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ni bdud phyir rgol ba la sogs pa gzhan dag gis mi bkri zhing mi 'phrogs pa yin te /
translated: he is not led astray or seduced by others, such as Mara, the adversary, etc.

original: lam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has seen the path.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni lhad bcug pa shes so //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa nyid kyis ni lhad bcug pa shes so //
translated: Because he possesses wisdom, he knows the interpolation.

original: lhad bcug pa ni dam pa'i chos 'jig par byed pa'i tshig lhad bcug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhad bcug pa ni dam pa'i chos 'jig par byed pa'i tshig lhad bcug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The interpolation is the interpolation of words that destroy the true Dharma.

original: de la nag po bstan pa'i gnyen por 'di ni mdo la sogs pa la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa yin pa'i phyir don gyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: de la nag po bstan pa'i gnyen por 'di ni mdo la sogs pa la 'jug pa la sogs pa'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa yin pa'i phyir don gyi tshig yin no //
translated: In this regard, the antidote to the teaching of the black side is the meaning of the words, because it is explained by the Perfectly Enlightened One in the sutras, etc.

original: 'di'i chos nyid dang 'gal ba nyid kyis bdud la sogs pas smras pa yin pa'i phyir don ma yin pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'dres pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: 'di'i chos nyid dang 'gal ba nyid kyis bdud la sogs pas smras pa yin pa'i phyir don ma yin pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba dang / 'dres pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Because they contradict reality, they are the words of MƒÅra, etc.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni skyabs ngan par zhugs pa rnams dad par byas nas bstan pa la 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni skyabs ngan par zhugs pa rnams dad par byas nas bstan pa la 'dzud par byed do //
translated: By means of the superknowledges, having inspired faith in those who have entered bad paths, he causes them to enter the teaching.

original: thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: By means of skill in methods, he brings sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de ltar na dran pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dran pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Thus the distinctive possession of the qualities of mindfulness, etc. is presented.

original: sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni bcu gnyis pas bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa ni bcu gnyis pas bstan to //
translated: The distinctive practice is presented in the twelfth verse.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ngoms mi shes pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: ngoms mi shes pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: It is presented as insatiable, etc.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bcu gsum pas bstan to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bcu gsum pas bstan to //
translated: The distinctive full recognition of sentient beings is presented in the thirteenth verse.

original: ji lta zhe na ;
analyzed: ji lta zhe na ;
translated: How so?

original: de de ltar mngon par brtson pas sbyin pas kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas te bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis tshig bzhi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar mngon par brtson pas sbyin pas kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas te bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis tshig bzhi bstan pa'o //
translated: The four lines beginning with ‚ÄúHe manifests a form body‚Äù show the four means of gathering disciples.

original: gzugs kyi lus kun tu bstan pa ni rang gi ris la chags pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi lus kun tu bstan pa ni rang gi ris la chags pa rnams la'o //
translated: He manifests a form body for those attached to their own class.

original: chos bshad pa ni the tshom za ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: chos bshad pa ni the tshom za ba rnams la'o //
translated: He explains the Dharma for those who doubt.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brjod pa ni thabs 'khrul ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brjod pa ni thabs 'khrul ba rnams la'o //
translated: He describes the conduct of the bodhisattvas for those confused about the means.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid smos pa ni yongs su skyo ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i che ba nyid smos pa ni yongs su skyo ba rnams la'o //
translated: He mentions the greatness of the tathagatas for those who are weary.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pa bstan pa ni de la mngon par dga' ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pa bstan pa ni de la mngon par dga' ba rnams la'o //
translated: He shows the faults of cyclic existence for those who delight in it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi phan yon yongs su bstan pa ni mi 'jug pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi phan yon yongs su bstan pa ni mi 'jug pa rnams la'o //
translated: He shows the benefits of the wisdom of the buddhas for those who do not enter it.

original: blo chung ba rnams la ni tshig tha mas yongs su smin par byed pas bstan to //
analyzed: blo chung ba rnams la ni tshig tha mas yongs su smin par byed pas bstan to //
translated: He matures those of small understanding with the last line.

original: de la don brjed pa'i gnod pa dang / bya ba brjed pa'i gnod pa'i rnam pa gnyis gcig tu byas nas gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la don brjed pa'i gnod pa dang / bya ba brjed pa'i gnod pa'i rnam pa gnyis gcig tu byas nas gzhag ste /
translated: The fault of forgetting the meaning and the fault of forgetting the action are counted as one.

original: 'di yang tshig gnyis kyis rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang tshig gnyis kyis rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: This is also divided into two phrases.

original: 'di'i gnyen po @70b ni yi ge ste /
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po @70b ni yi ge ste /
translated: The antidote to that is writing.

original: yi ge'i 'bru rnams kyis byin pa la sogs pa'i don dang / byas pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir bris nas 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru rnams kyis byin pa la sogs pa'i don dang / byas pa la sogs pa'i bya ba rnams mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir bris nas 'jog par byed do //
translated: One writes down the meaning of the letters, such as the meaning of giving, and the actions, such as the action of giving, in order not to forget them.

original: gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos kyis ni lta ba ngan pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi bstan bcos kyis ni lta ba ngan pa sel bar byed do //
translated: The treatise on logic eliminates bad views.

original: sgra'i bstan bcos kyis ni blo chung ba sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sgra'i bstan bcos kyis ni blo chung ba sel bar byed do //
translated: The treatise on grammar eliminates the small mind.

original: yongs su blangs pa'i nor ma sbas pa'i gnyen por brgya ste des sbed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su blangs pa'i nor ma sbas pa'i gnyen por brgya ste des sbed pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'du ba dang 'god pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por rtsis dang sho thabs te /
analyzed: 'du ba dang 'god pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por rtsis dang sho thabs te /

original: de gnyis kyi 'du 'god shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'du 'god shes pa'i phyir ro //

original: khams mi mnyam pa ni skems pa dang brjed byed do //
analyzed: khams mi mnyam pa ni skems pa dang brjed byed do //
translated: Uneven elements is the humors of wind and bile.

original: sems can gnod pa ni 'byung bo'i gdon to ;
analyzed: sems can gnod pa ni 'byung bo'i gdon to ;
translated: Harm to sentient beings is harm by spirits.

original: / rgyu las byung ba'i nad kyi gnod pa ni ro langs kyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: / rgyu las byung ba'i nad kyi gnod pa ni ro langs kyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: Harm from disease is harm from zombies,

original: gshed byed sgrub pa la sogs pas rims la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gshed byed sgrub pa la sogs pas rims la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: such as the arising of fevers through the practice of sorcery.

original: zla ba la sogs pa log par mthong ba dang / mtshan ngan pa la sogs pa yan lag gi skyon rnam par smin pa kho nas thob pa des byas pa'i rnam par 'tshe pa'i gnod pa'i ngo lon yang shes so //
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa log par mthong ba dang / mtshan ngan pa la sogs pa yan lag gi skyon rnam par smin pa kho nas thob pa des byas pa'i rnam par 'tshe pa'i gnod pa'i ngo lon yang shes so //
translated: One should know that harm from harm is harm from the maturation of limbs, such as seeing the moon as double and so on, and the faults of limbs such as bad marks and so on.

original: de la sdom pa'i cho ga ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i cho ga ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: Among these, the rite of restraint is the ethics of restraint,

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po'o //

original: bsam gtan ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'i gnyen po'o //

original: mngon par shes pa rnams ni skyabs ngan pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams ni skyabs ngan pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The superknowledges are the antidote to bad refuge.

original: tshad med pa rnams ni log pa'i bsod nams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams ni log pa'i bsod nams kyi gnyen po'o //

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni log pa'i thar pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni log pa'i thar pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The formless [absorptions] are the antidote to the false liberation.

original: rgyu bzhi dang ldan par zhes bya ba la gnod pa gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba med pa ni tho 'tshams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzhi dang ldan par zhes bya ba la gnod pa gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba med pa ni tho 'tshams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase endowed with four causes means that the first cause is the absence of harm from others, which is called the absence of disturbance.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba skyes pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba skyes pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second cause is the arising of happiness free from misdeeds, which is called the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa ni snying rje dang ldan pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa ni snying rje dang ldan pas zhes bya ba'o //

original: dgos pa rnam par dag pa ni mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa rnam par dag pa ni mthar gyis sangs rgyas kyi chos la dgod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //

original: shes rab snying rjes yongs sbyangs bsam pa can //
analyzed: shes rab snying rjes yongs sbyangs bsam pa can //

original: sa 'bras rnam pa bzhi la rab gnas pa //
analyzed: sa 'bras rnam pa bzhi la rab gnas pa //

original: blo yis 'khor ba'i skyon rnams rab dpyad de //
analyzed: blo yis 'khor ba'i skyon rnams rab dpyad de //
translated: the one who thoroughly examines the faults of samsara with the mind,üîΩhaving seen the faults of samsara,

analyzed: zhi ba'i dbyings ni sems la rab smon nas //

analyzed: mtshan ma med la mang du gnas ldan pa'i //

original: sa drug @71a * //
analyzed: sa drug @71a * //

analyzed: mtshan ma med par thob par 'gyur //

original: sa drug pa'i 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: sa drug pa'i 'grel ba ni /

analyzed: lnga pa rnam par gzhag 'dod pa'i //

original: rgyu de nyid ni khyad 'phags pas //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid ni khyad 'phags pas //

analyzed: drug pa rab tu bstan pa yin //

analyzed: sa bzhi pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa 'di'i 'brel ba ston par byed pa ste /
translated: The fourth level and so on indicates the connection with this level.

original: sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: On the first level, because the dharmadhatu is seen,

original: gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa spangs pa yin no //

original: sa'i 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: sa'i 'brel ba yin te /

original: lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste zhes gang gsungs pa'o //

original: chos la tha dad nga rgyal ni //
analyzed: chos la tha dad nga rgyal ni //
translated: The pride of difference with regard to the dharmas

original: chos mngon zhen las skyes gang yin //üîΩde yi gnyen po rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: chos mngon zhen las skyes gang yin // de yi gnyen po rnam pa bcu //
translated: arises from attachment to the Abhidharma.üîΩIts antidote is taught in the sixth stage

original: drug pa las ni rab tu bstan //
analyzed: drug pa las ni rab tu bstan //
translated: as having ten aspects.

original: de la chos thams cad de /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad de /
translated: Therein, all dharmas

original: skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: are the twelve sense-spheres. They are the same, because they are without an imagined essence.

original: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid ces gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi 'pho'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa mnyam pa nyid ces gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The signs of birth and death are the same, because all dharmas are without acceptance and without rejection.

original: blang ba ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: blang ba ni skye ba yin la /
translated: because taking up is birth and

original: dor ba ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dor ba ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: giving up is death.

original: gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma ni phung po lnga po dag ste /
analyzed: gang zag la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma ni phung po lnga po dag ste /
translated: The sign of clinging to the personal entity is the five aggregates.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mdo las / dge slong dag 'di na gang la la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo las / dge slong dag 'di na gang la la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, here some person, having directly experienced the five aggregates as entities,

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa med na gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de'i gnyen por sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa med na gang zag tu mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir de'i gnyen por sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: If the imagined form, etc., did not exist, then clinging to the personal entity, etc., would not exist. Therefore, the antidote is the sameness with magical creations, etc.

original: nyon mongs ba glo bur ba dang 'khor ba'i dri ma bstsal bas gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs ba glo bur ba dang 'khor ba'i dri ma bstsal bas gnyen po yin no //
translated: It is an antidote because it removes the defilements that are adventitious and the stain of cyclic existence.

original: byi dor byas pa yin te /
analyzed: byi dor byas pa yin te /
translated: It is polished,

original: gnas byi dor byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas byi dor byed pa bzhin no //
translated: like a polished surface.

original: mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyen po mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyen po mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the conviction of sameness, means because of the conviction of the sameness of the antidote.

original: de ltar na rjes su mthun par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su mthun par byas pa yin te /
translated: Thus it is made suitable,

original: de bzhin nyid kyis rang @71b gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis rang @71b gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of the latter is fully understood.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyen po 'di lta bu ni kun nas nyon mongs pa zlog par byed pa yin no snyam du rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyen po 'di lta bu ni kun nas nyon mongs pa zlog par byed pa yin no snyam du rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-discrimination, i.e. because of the absence of the discrimination that such an antidote is the counteragent to the defilements.

original: bzod pa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of acquiescence, i.e. because of conformity with acquiescence.

original: de ma thob po zhes bya ba'i tshig gis na zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i sgo rjes su thob pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thob po zhes bya ba'i tshig gis na zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i sgo rjes su thob pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The words: ‚Äúnot yet attained‚Äù refer to the statement: ‚Äúby this alone, the door to the acceptance of the non-production of all dharmas is not attained‚Äù.

original: 'di yan chad ni zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad zin pa la snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bshad zin pa la snyegs so //
translated: From here onwards, i.e. from the eighth stage onwards.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal cha phra ba'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal cha phra ba'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the special progress, i.e. because it is established as the counteragent to the subtle aspect of pride.

original: 'di nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rtogs pa nas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ltar rtogs pa nas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From this point on means from the time of realizing the nature of all phenomena in that way, up to he is born everywhere through the door of liberation that is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo kun du skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung 'dis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgo kun du skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung 'dis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This passage explains the distinctive practice of the path of nonabiding nirvana.

original: sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Having compassion for sentient beings and so on teaches the distinctive practice of the path of nonabiding nirvana.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: For two reasons, it would not be the path of nonabiding nirvana:

original: nyan thos bzhin du snying rje dang bral ba dang / 'khor ba pa bzhin du shes rab dang bral bas so //
analyzed: nyan thos bzhin du snying rje dang bral ba dang / 'khor ba pa bzhin du shes rab dang bral bas so //
translated: like the sravakas, it would lack compassion, and like the worldly, it would lack wisdom.

original: snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyis ni 'gyur bas de'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyis ni 'gyur bas de'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa ston par byed do //
translated: Since it is transformed by both compassion and wisdom, therefore it is shown to be endowed with those two.

original: snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa ni sla bas sgo gsum nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su rtog pa bstan to //
analyzed: snying rje'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa ni sla bas sgo gsum nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su rtog pa bstan to //
translated: The possession of the distinctive feature of compassion is easy, so the three doors are taught to be the thorough investigation of dependent origination.

original: sgrub pa dang brgal ba'i lam yin pas brgal pa'i lam dang mtshan nyid de dag rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang brgal ba'i lam yin pas brgal pa'i lam dang mtshan nyid de dag rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Since it is the path of practice and the path of argument, the path of argument and its characteristics are presented.

original: 'dis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su rtog ces bya bar sbyar te /üîΩthams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yongs su rtog ces bya bar sbyar te / thams cad ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di nas bzung ste /
translated: This is connected with ‚Äúthoroughly investigates dependent origination.‚Äù

original: byed pa po med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: byed pa po med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: Everything arises from the conception of a self. This is taught from here up to ‚Äúthere is no agent.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su rtog pa ni de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su rtog pa ni de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The thorough investigation of the ultimate truth is presented as follows: He thinks as follows:

original: 'di ltar khams gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the three realms are mind only.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ni srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po gang dag ces bya ba bzung ste /üîΩde de ltar rten cing 'brel bar @72a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa ni srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po gang dag ces bya ba bzung ste / de de ltar rten cing 'brel bar @72a * //
translated: The presentation of conventional truth is indicated by the words ‚Äúwhatever are the twelve members of existence.üîΩ‚Äù Thus, the twelve members of existence are the presentation of conventional truth.

original: 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: The presentation of the establishment of dependent origination is indicated by the words ‚Äúin this way, dependent origination is tenfold.

original: de ltar mdo rnam par phye nas sgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mdo rnam par phye nas sgrub pa rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: ‚Äù Having thus analyzed the s≈´tra, the meaning of the members will be explained by the words ‚Äúthus, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa de sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa de sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the establishment of selflessness.

original: rigs pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what reasoning?

original: 'jig rten 'byung ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'byung ba thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The words ‚Äúall worldly arising, etc.

original: de dang bral na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ston par byed do //
analyzed: de dang bral na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ston par byed do //
translated: ‚Äù indicate the forward order and reverse order.üîΩThe words ‚Äúif the self existed ultimately, etc.

original: bdag don dam par yod du zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bdag nyid sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag don dam par yod du zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa bdag nyid sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù indicate the forward order and reverse order themselves.

original: de la sbyor ba ni 'jig rten 'byung ba thams cad kyi rgyu ni bdag tu lta ba yin te nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni 'jig rten 'byung ba thams cad kyi rgyu ni bdag tu lta ba yin te nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The argument is this: the cause of all mundane things is the view of self, because it is the defilement of defilement,

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the defilements of ignorance, etc.

original: chos mi mthun pa ni lam bzhin no //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni lam bzhin no //
translated: The counter-example is like the path.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyang ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid kyang ma grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the defilement of defilement is not established,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is a defilement, like attachment, etc., because it is engaged in a distorted mode.

original: phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa bdag med pa rnams la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rnam par zhugs pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa bdag med pa rnams la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is engaged in a distorted mode because it is attached to the self in regard to the selflessness of form, etc.

original: don dam par na bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par na bdag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimately there is no self.

original: 'di ni rang gi sde ba rnams kyis srol btod zin pas 'phan mi skyed do //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi sde ba rnams kyis srol btod zin pas 'phan mi skyed do //
translated: This is not a new invention of our own school, because it is well known in the scriptures.

original: de las brgal ba rnam par gzhag pa ste gang zhig bdag med na rigs pa gang gis der 'dzin pa 'jug pa 'di smros shig ces zer na /
analyzed: de las brgal ba rnam par gzhag pa ste gang zhig bdag med na rigs pa gang gis der 'dzin pa 'jug pa 'di smros shig ces zer na /
translated: What is the reason for the occurrence of the apprehension of self when there is no self?

original: 'di'i lan rnam par gzhag pa ni byis pa'i blo nyid dang mi shes pa la sogs pa rgyu lhag ma rnams kyis bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs nas bdag tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i lan rnam par gzhag pa ni byis pa'i blo nyid dang mi shes pa la sogs pa rgyu lhag ma rnams kyis bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs nas bdag tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The answer to this is: The answer is that the ignorant, etc., are confused about selflessness due to the remaining causes, and so they apprehend a self.

original: byis pa'i blo can du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni blo chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can du gyur pas zhes bya ba ni blo chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ignorant are those who have little understanding.

original: de'i 'og tu bdag med du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhung mtha' dag 'phen to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bdag med du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhung mtha' dag 'phen to //
translated: The rest of the text is implied by the following statement: ‚ÄúEven if they know that there is no self, etc.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang yod bzhin du ci'i phyir mi shes pa dang / ser sna dag kho na smos zhes rgol ba 'di'i lan gdab pa'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag gi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang yod bzhin du ci'i phyir mi shes pa dang / ser sna dag kho na smos zhes rgol ba 'di'i lan gdab pa'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag gi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In response to the objection, ‚ÄúWhy do you mention only ignorance and miserliness, when there are other afflictions?,‚Äù the root of the members of existence is stated.

original: srid pa'i yan lag 'di ni gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag 'di ni gtso bo yin te /
translated: This member of existence is the principal one.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan las skye ba rnams kyi rgyu ni sred pa yin @72b no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan las skye ba rnams kyi rgyu ni sred pa yin @72b no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, craving is the cause of those who are born from others.

original: bdag med bzhin du yang ji lta ba bzhin du yang ji ltar 'jig rten skye ba dag srid pa de ltar mdo nyid las rigs pa dag rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: bdag med bzhin du yang ji lta ba bzhin du yang ji ltar 'jig rten skye ba dag srid pa de ltar mdo nyid las rigs pa dag rab tu bstan to //
translated: The Sutra itself teaches the reason why beings are born in the world even though there is no self:

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the reason?üîΩIt is because of the formation of merit,

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang stsogs zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang stsogs zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: the formation of demerit, and the formation of the imperturbable.‚Äù

original: de la yongs su ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su ma btang ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnot relinquished‚Äù means not abandoned.

original: gang dag gis she na 'du byed dag gis so //
analyzed: gang dag gis she na 'du byed dag gis so //
translated: By what? By the formations.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: sems kyi sa bon no //
analyzed: sems kyi sa bon no //
translated: They are the seeds of the mind.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What kind are they?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are contaminated and appropriated.

original: gang gi tshe na zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na zhe na /
translated: When?

original: phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la'o //
translated: In the future.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What?

original: skye ba rga shi'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba rga shi'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Birth, old age, and death.

original: sems nyid yang srid pa dang srid pa bar ma gnyis kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sa bon yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid yang srid pa dang srid pa bar ma gnyis kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sa bon yin no //
translated: The mind itself is the seed because it is the cause of both the intermediate existence and the existence at birth.

original: de nyid skye ba dang rga ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid skye ba dang rga ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: It is taught by the words ‚Äúbirth, aging, and so on.‚Äù

original: mdo las mngon par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba ni bar mdo'i srid pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo las mngon par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba ni bar mdo'i srid pa yin no //
translated: The sutra mentions ‚Äúmanifestation‚Äù because it is the intermediate existence.

original: yang srid pa zhes 'byung ba ni skye ba'i srid pa yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa zhes 'byung ba ni skye ba'i srid pa yin no //
translated: It mentions ‚Äúrebirth‚Äù because it is the existence at birth.

original: de dag gis bsdus pa la nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir na nye bar song ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus pa la nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir na nye bar song ba yin no //
translated: It is ‚Äúapproached‚Äù because it is included in those two.

original: bsod nams la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyi'i myu gu skye ba dang chos mthun pa nyid du ston par byed do ;
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyi'i myu gu skye ba dang chos mthun pa nyid du ston par byed do ;
translated: The words ‚Äúmerit and so on‚Äù indicate the similarity of the external sprout.

original: / de la 'di ni chos mthun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: / de la 'di ni chos mthun pa nyid yin te /
translated: The similarity is as follows.

original: myu gu skyed par byed pa la dang por zhing dang / lud kyis dgab pa dang / chu'i khams kyis brlan pa dang / phyi'i gnod pa 'byung du 'ong bas rgya la sogs pas bskor dgos pa de thams cad nang gi dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes ston par byed do ;
analyzed: myu gu skyed par byed pa la dang por zhing dang / lud kyis dgab pa dang / chu'i khams kyis brlan pa dang / phyi'i gnod pa 'byung du 'ong bas rgya la sogs pas bskor dgos pa de thams cad nang gi dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes ston par byed do ;
translated: In order to produce the sprout, first the field must be covered with manure, moistened with the element of water, and surrounded by a fence, etc. , in order to prevent the occurrence of external harm. All of this must be applied to the internal.

original: / bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: / bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means not by another.

analyzed: rang gis 'jig pa'i blo sngon du gtong ba med ces bya ba ni bdag gis 'di ltar gzhig par bya'o snyam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the prior intention to destroy itself‚Äù means ‚ÄúI will destroy it in this way.‚Äù

original: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te //
translated: The condensed meaning is as follows:

original: las la brten nas rnam par shes //
analyzed: las la brten nas rnam par shes //

original: ming rang gzugs su myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ming rang gzugs su myong bar 'gyur //

analyzed: nur nur po la sogs rim gyis // skye mched drug po kun du 'byung //
translated: Through the stages of kalala, etc.üîΩThe six sense bases come into existence.

original: skye mched dod par gyur nas ni //üîΩyul rnams la ni mngon par dga' //
analyzed: skye mched dod par gyur nas ni // yul rnams la ni mngon par dga' //

analyzed: bar zhes bya ba 'am phyi ma zhes bya ba ni ltos nas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //

analyzed: 'di skad du tshe 'di nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag yongs su brtag pa na /

analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ba yongs su brtag pa yin na zhes bshad pa yin no // gzhan dag ni gang la dgos pa sngon gyi mtha' yod pa'am /

original: gang zhig de'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por rnam par gnas pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i lto sa pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos por rnam par gnas pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' pa'i lto sa pa zhes bya ste /

original: ci'i phyir de skad bstan ce na /

analyzed: don gang la zhes bya ba ni don gang la brten nas da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa yin pa de 'dri @76b ba'o //

original: cig shos kyis kyang bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir las de yang 'bras bu mi 'byin to zhes bya ba'i don 'di la da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa yin te /

analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang bcas pa yongs su brtags pa'i phyir ro //

translated: ‚ÄúBecause it definitely brings about the establishment of a subsequent existence‚Äù means that although the formations that are conditions for ignorance in the context of the prior limit are projected by that ignorance, as long as the establishment of a subsequent existence is not definite, the formations are not established as the conditions for ignorance.

translated: and some karma is experienced in this life and is not experienced in the

analyzed: de 'bras skye phyir byas chud za //

analyzed: yid mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal cha phra ba nyid do //

analyzed: de yang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal @77b nyid de / de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: de dag ni byis pa rnams kyis legs par mi rtogs pas na yid mi 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no /

analyzed: tshor ba dang mthun pa'i tshor ba yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'di ltar gang las tshor ba dang / tshor ba ma yin pa de thams cad tshor ba zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //

original: sdug bsngal nyid rags pa'i rnam pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid rags pa'i rnam pa ni /
translated: The gross aspect of suffering is

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid de /

analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis kyang bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yongs su gdung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid yin pas /

translated: Thus, the two kinds of suffering are called the gross form of suffering. The suffering of suffering is the suffering of contact and the suffering of sensation.

analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma de dag ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do zhes gang gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams gzhan gyis ma byas pa zhes bya ba la rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dir rang gi rgyu ni rigs mthun pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: The aspect of the origin of the three kinds of suffering should be applied in the same way.üîΩThe members of existence are not created by another because they arise from their own causes. Here, the own cause is the seed of a homogeneous type.

original: 'o na ni rang kho nas byas pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su sbang ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rang kho nas byas pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su sbang ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis ma byas pa zhes smras te /
translated: If that is so, then they are created by themselves. In order to completely abandon this objection, it is said that they are not created by themselves.

original: bdag nyid kyis byas pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis byas pa dag ma yin no //
translated: They are not produced by themselves.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they arise from conditions.

original: rkyen ni 'dir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: rkyen ni 'dir lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the condition is the cooperative condition.

original: 'di gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show both of these,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic predispositions. ‚Äù

original: rgyu ni 'dir rigs mthun pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'dir rigs mthun pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Here, the cause is the homogeneous cause.

original: rkyen ni lhan cig byed pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni lhan cig byed pa'o //
translated: The condition is the cooperative condition.

original: 'o na ni rgyu dang rkyen lhan cig pas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di dgag pa'i phyir gnyi gas ma byas pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu dang rkyen lhan cig pas bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di dgag pa'i phyir gnyi gas ma byas pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to refute the objection, ‚ÄúThey are produced by the simultaneous assemblage of causes and conditions, ‚Äù it is said, ‚ÄúThey are not produced by both. ‚Äù

original: @78a * // skye ba tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @78a * // skye ba tsam dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are related to mere arising.

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig 'ga' la byed na ni de lta na des bskyed pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos 'ga' zhig 'ga' la byed na ni de lta na des bskyed pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If a certain phenomenon were to produce another, then the latter would be produced by the former.

original: brgya la ci'i phyir mi byed snyam na de'i phyir bya ba'i dus na mi gnas pas zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: brgya la ci'i phyir mi byed snyam na de'i phyir bya ba'i dus na mi gnas pas zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhy not do it?‚Äù then the root text states, ‚ÄúBecause it does not endure at the time it is done.‚Äù

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it ceases as soon as it arises.

original: zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the root text.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel ba ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel ba ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the statement, ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are volitions,‚Äù is connected with arising.

original: skye ba dang 'brel pa ni skye ba dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'brel pa ni skye ba dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconnected with arising‚Äù means connected with the arising of the effect.

original: gal te de lta yin te bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyi ga las ma yin na /üîΩ'o na ni rgyu med pa dag las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su spong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin te bdag las ma yin gzhan las ma yin gnyi ga las ma yin na / 'o na ni rgyu med pa dag las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di yongs su spong ba'i phyir /
translated: If this is so, and the effect does not arise from itself, from another, or from both,üîΩthen the objection, ‚ÄúThey arise without a cause,‚Äù is raised.

original: srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa'i phyir rgyu med pa las 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa'i phyir rgyu med pa las 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to completely avoid this objection, the root text states, ‚ÄúThey do not arise from a noncause, because they conform to the pattern of existence.‚Äù

original: srid pa ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Existence is samsara.

original: de'i lugs dang mthun pas de'i phyir rgyu med pa pa bdag yin no //
analyzed: de'i lugs dang mthun pas de'i phyir rgyu med pa pa bdag yin no //
translated: Because they conform to its pattern, they do not arise from a noncause.

original: rgyu med pa pa yin du zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa pa yin du zin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de nyid rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: If they were causeless, etc.

original: ci zhig ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ston par byed ce na /
translated: What does this passage show?

original: rgyu med pa pa nyid yin na ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu med pa pa nyid yin na ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they were causeless, the members of existence would have the characteristic of arising, not non-arising.

original: mi 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skye ba dang mi skye ba 'di dag ci las gyur /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i skye ba dang mi skye ba 'di dag ci las gyur /
translated: From what do these two, arising and non-arising, come?

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur gyi chad pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur gyi chad pa kho nar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, it would not be existence in accordance with the natural order, but rather it would be annihilation.

original: srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa srid pa dang mthun pa nyid kyang yod de /
analyzed: srid pa'i lugs dang mthun pa srid pa dang mthun pa nyid kyang yod de /
translated: But there is existence in accordance with the natural order, i.e., existence in accordance with the way things are.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic forces,‚Äù etc. This is the way existence is conceived to occur.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The remaining members should also be applied in the same way.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / rang gis ma byas par yongs su brtag par ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma byas pa dang / rang gis ma byas par yongs su brtag par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúArising from causes and conditions‚Äù means that it is not created by itself or by another.

original: skye ba dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni gnyi gas ma byas par yongs su brtag par ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni gnyi gas ma byas par yongs su brtag par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúConnected with arising‚Äù means that it is not created by both.

original: med pas zad par so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa nyid so sor brtag pa ste /
analyzed: med pas zad par so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa nyid so sor brtag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDiscerning its cessation as non-existence‚Äù means discerning its absence of cause.

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni srid pa med do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na ni srid pa med do //
translated: If it were without a cause, there would be no existence.

original: rgyu yod pa nyid yin na ni srid pa yod do //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa nyid yin na ni srid pa yod do //
translated: If it has a cause, then existence exists.

original: srid pa yod pa de zad pa ste de la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa yod pa de zad pa ste de la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: That existence is cessation, and that is discerned.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur so sor rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu po ji @78b skad du sbyar ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rnam pa bcur so sor rtog pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bcu po ji @78b skad du sbyar ba ston par byed do //
translated: This discernment of dependent origination in ten aspects is the discernment of the aspects of the truths.

original: mtshan nyid dang bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pa bstan te zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bden pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pa bstan te zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bden pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the discernment of the truths is concluded.

original: de gnyis rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pa ni mtshan nyid dang bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pa ni mtshan nyid dang bden pa rnam par gzhag pas yongs su brtag pa'o //
translated: The investigation of these two is the investigation of the principles of the characteristics and the truths.

original: sgrub pa dang brgal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas de yongs su brtag pa bstan na /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang brgal ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas de yongs su brtag pa bstan na /
translated: The investigation of dependent origination is taught from the perspective of the principles of proof, refutation, characteristics, and the truths.

original: cig 'di skad du sgrub pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang mtshan nyid dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: cig 'di skad du sgrub pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang mtshan nyid dang / bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, shouldn‚Äôt it be said that the investigation of dependent origination is from the perspective of the principles of proof, refutation, characteristics, and the truths?

original: 'di ltar der rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de yang sgo gsum nas yongs su brtag par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar der rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de yang sgo gsum nas yongs su brtag par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: In that case, dependent origination should be understood as investigated from three perspectives.

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here because

original: 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam pa bcur yongs su brtag pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'dir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam pa bcur yongs su brtag pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: in this context, the investigation of dependent origination is in terms of ten aspects.

original: rnam pa de dag gi nang nas rnam pa dang po sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gi nang nas rnam pa dang po sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: And from among those aspects, the first aspect is applied here.

original: 'di skad du sgrub pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas zhes ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'di skad du sgrub pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas zhes ma bshad do //
translated: It is not said, in terms of the establishment of the perfections, etc.

original: bden pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su brtag pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yongs su brtag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnam par gzhag pa yongs su brtag pa ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yongs su brtag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The investigation of the establishment of the truths should be understood as the investigation of ultimate and conventional truths,

original: rnam pa dgu bo 'di de dang der sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu bo 'di de dang der sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because these nine aspects are applied there.

original: yang zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa gzhan gnyis kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam pa bcu 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa gzhan gnyis kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam pa bcu 'chad pa ste /
translated: Again, in two other aspects, dependent origination is explained in ten aspects.

original: snying rje dang mthun pa rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje dang mthun pa rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: In accord with compassion, it is in accord with compassion.

original: ji ltar snying rje 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is in accord with compassion in the sense of the object of compassion, and in accord with compassion in the sense of the aspect of compassion.

original: de la snying rje dang mthun par yongs su brtag pa yang rnam pa bzhi po kun du rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ni kun du rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: de la snying rje dang mthun par yongs su brtag pa yang rnam pa bzhi po kun du rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ni kun du rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ste /
translated: Therein, the investigation in accord with compassion is fourfold: the investigation of delusion, the investigation of error, the investigation of the absence of error, and the investigation of the absence of self.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni yongs su rtog pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni yongs su rtog pa gcig yin no //
translated: These two aspects are one single misconception.

original: ji ltar gang la kun du rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ces bya ba kun du rmongs pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gang la kun du rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ces bya ba kun du rmongs pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: As to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the misconception that is the error? ‚Äù, the error is the non-clarity of the misconception.

original: phyin ci log ni log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni log par rtog pa'o //
translated: The error is the false imagination.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar kun tu rmongs pa de ston par byed do //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji ltar kun tu rmongs pa de ston par byed do //
translated: As to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the misconception that is the adherence to the belief in a self? ‚Äù, etc., it shows the misconception.üîΩAs to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the error that is the adherence to the belief in a self? ‚Äù, etc., it shows the error.

original: byis pa'i blo can zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phyin ci log pa de ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phyin ci log pa de ston par byed pa ste /
translated: The one who has the intellect of a child is the one who has the error.

original: bdag tu phyin ci log bas blo chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu phyin ci log bas blo chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the error of the belief in a self, he has a small intellect.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba ni gang la kun du rmongs pa de ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba ni gang la kun du rmongs pa de ston par byed pa ste /
translated: As to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the characteristic of the members of existence? ‚Äù, it shows the characteristic of the members of existence.

original: de 'di snyam du @79a * //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du @79a * //
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: sems te byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sems te byis pa'i blo can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who has the intellect of a child, who has the adherence to the belief in a self, etc.

original: 'jig par byed pa su yang med do zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lugs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rab tu rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa su yang med do zhes de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lugs su 'byung ba'i rnam par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rab tu rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva thoroughly investigates the forward order of dependent origination.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba ni gang la phyin ci log pa de ston par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba ni gang la phyin ci log pa de ston par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: The characteristics of the members of existence are taught in order to show the error of those who believe that the self is the agent.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te bden pa rnams mi shes pa ni don dam par ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te bden pa rnams mi shes pa ni don dam par ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: He thinks: ‚ÄúThe non-understanding of the truths is ignorance in the ultimate sense.

original: byed pa po la mngon par zhen pas las rnams yod par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po la mngon par zhen pas las rnams yod par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Because of the attachment to the agent, the actions come to be.‚Äù

original: de ltar na phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na phyin ci log yin te /
translated: Thus, it is an error.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'du byed rnams 'byung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The formations do not arise through the power of ignorance.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bdag gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They arise through the power of the self.

original: de ni las rnams kyi byed pa po dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa'i gzhi yang yin no snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni las rnams kyi byed pa po dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa'i gzhi yang yin no snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the agent of actions and the basis of virtue and vice.

original: de de ltar rmongs shing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de de ltar rmongs shing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, he is confused

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa ltar ro //üîΩkun gzhi dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag las /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam pa ltar ro // kun gzhi dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag las /
translated: in the manner that has been explained.

original: thar pa yongs su btsal bar bya ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: thar pa yongs su btsal bar bya ba'i rigs te /
translated: He should seek liberation from the store-consciousness and the actual consciousnesses.

original: 'di ltar 'di gnyis kho na nyon mongs pa dang ; las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /üîΩgang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de nyid ji skad du bshad pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum las rnam par byang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di gnyis kho na nyon mongs pa dang ; las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la / gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de nyid ji skad du bshad pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum las rnam par byang bar 'gyur /
translated: For, only these two are completely defiled by the defilements of passion, action, and birth.

original: dag par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: dag par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: And, that which is completely defiled is purified by the three kinds of purification that have been explained.

original: de ltar so sor rtog pa las gzhan du bdag las yongs su tshol te /
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog pa las gzhan du bdag las yongs su tshol te /
translated: But, he seeks liberation elsewhere, apart from the discernment of these two.

original: de nyid 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he is bound.

original: grol bar 'gyur ro zhes so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol bar 'gyur ro zhes so sor rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he discerns that he will be liberated.

original: de lta bu ni /
analyzed: de lta bu ni /
translated: This is

original: gzhan las thar pa yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan las thar pa yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: the search for liberation elsewhere.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te 'di ltar khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam ste zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúThe three realms are mind only.‚ÄùüîΩHow is the search through another mode?

original: / rnam pa gzhan gyis yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan gyis ni gzhan gyi rnam pas so //
analyzed: / rnam pa gzhan gyis yongs su tshol ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan gyis ni gzhan gyi rnam pas so //
translated: Through another mode means through another aspect.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mi 'dra ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The cause is not similar.

original: de lta bu ni rnam pa gzhan gyis tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni rnam pa gzhan gyis tshol ba yin no //
translated: This is the search through another mode.

original: rgyu mi 'dra ba rnams bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba smras so//
