analyzed: gang gi phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis 'khor bar 'khyams pa de'i phyir dka' thub drag pos thar pa ma yin te /
translated: But because one wanders in cyclic existence through karma and afflictions, liberation is not through intense asceticism.

original: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang / len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam gyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúIgnorance, craving, and grasping are uninterrupted through the path of afflictions.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam gyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Formation and existence are uninterrupted through the path of karma.

original: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi lam gyis rgyun mi 'chad pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: The remaining links are uninterrupted through the path of suffering.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa 'jig rten rgyang phan pa rnams ni rgyu med pas thar pa tshol lo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'jig rten rgyang phan pa rnams ni rgyu med pas thar pa tshol lo //
translated: The Lokayatas, on the other hand, seek liberation through the absence of a cause.

original: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ni rang gi ngang kho nas 'jig pas 'di dag gi zhig pa mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyu 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dngos po rnams ni rang gi ngang kho nas 'jig pas 'di dag gi zhig pa mya ngan las 'das pa la rgyu 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Thus, since things perish by their very nature, there is no cause at all for their destruction, which is nirvana.

original: de skad du srog ni 'di kho nar 'tsho bar zad kyi tshe phyi ma med do zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: de skad du srog ni 'di kho nar 'tsho bar zad kyi tshe phyi ma med do zhes 'dzer to //
translated: They say, ‚ÄúLife is only in this world, and there is no life after death.‚Äù

original: de'i gnyen por sngon dang mtha'i bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por sngon dang mtha'i bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThe beginning, the end, and the middle . . . ‚Äù

original: mtha'i bar ni sngon gyi mtha'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: mtha'i bar ni sngon gyi mtha'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir la /
translated: The end is the end of the middle, because it arises from the cause of the beginning.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ni mtha'i bar gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ni mtha'i bar gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The middle is the middle of the end, because it arises from the cause of the end.

original: 'dir 'thad pa smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'thad pa smras pa /
translated: Here, they give a logical reason:

original: gzhan du na ni sems can sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni sems can sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, sentient beings would not be diverse.

original: sems can rnams sna tshogs pa ni ngo bo nyid sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams sna tshogs pa ni ngo bo nyid sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The diversity of sentient beings is the diversity of their natures.

original: rgyu med pa nyid yin na der mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid yin na der mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa ste /
translated: If they were without a cause, that would not be the case.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' la ltos pa'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya ba de ni 'gag pa rgyun 'chad pa ste @81b zhes
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi mtha' la ltos pa'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya ba de ni 'gag pa rgyun 'chad pa ste @81b zhes
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù refers to the past.

original: bya ba'i bar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i bar gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way, through the cessation of ignorance, karmic formations cease‚Äù refers to the cessation of the continuum.

original: thar pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa gzhan kho na yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: thar pa gzhan yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba ni thar pa gzhan kho na yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeking liberation elsewhere‚Äù means seeking liberation in something else.

original: thar pa de yang rnam pa bzhir yongs su rtog par byed de /
analyzed: thar pa de yang rnam pa bzhir yongs su rtog par byed de /
translated: Liberation is imagined in four ways:

original: thar pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thar pa rnam pa bzhi po de bye brag tu ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thar pa rnam pa bzhi po de bye brag tu ston par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLiberation is the absence of form‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag ni 'di 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa la thar par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa la thar par rtog par byed de /
translated: They imagine liberation to be connected with the suffering of conditioned existence because it is connected with the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: 'di ltar 'du shes med pa la thar par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du shes med pa la thar par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed do //
translated: Thus, they are conceited about the liberation of the non-perceptive state.

original: de la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir thar pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par mi bzhag ste /
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir thar pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par mi bzhag ste /
translated: However, because it is associated with the suffering of formations, it is not established as having the characteristics of liberation.

original: thar pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang zhes gang smra ba ste /
analyzed: thar pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang zhes gang smra ba ste /
translated: Liberation is said to have the characteristic of the complete pacification of all suffering.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye mched drug ces bya ba'i bar de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe condition of ignorance gives rise to formations, up to the six sense sources‚Äù explains the suffering of formations.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag las yongs su brtag par bshad de /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag las yongs su brtag par bshad de /
translated: It is explained that the extreme is also fully investigated from causes and conditions.

original: mtha'i bar yang rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mtha'i bar yang rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba ste /
translated: Up to the extreme is said to arise from causes and conditions. The statement ‚ÄúThe condition of ignorance gives rise to formations‚Äù means that formations arise from causes and conditions.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The same applies to the remaining links.üîΩThe future limit is also related to birth.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yang skye ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yang skye ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni skye ba dang 'brel ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations‚Äù is related to birth.

original: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The same applies to the remaining links.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas tshor ba zhes bya ba'i bar de ni da ltar byung ba'i ltos pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúFrom consciousness up to feeling is the present‚Äù is related to the present.

original: da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de ni mtha'i bar yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de ni mtha'i bar yin te /
translated: That which is present is the middle of the two limits.

original: mtha' gnyis kyi bar gang yin pa de mtha'i bar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis kyi bar gang yin pa de mtha'i bar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The middle of the two limits is the middle.

original: de rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because it arises from causes and conditions means because it arises from ignorance and karmic formations.

original: skye ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth is the cause of the afflictions and karma.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag ni sngon gyi mtha'i dang po nyid du rab tu 'gyur ro //üîΩyang srid pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha' ba'i ltos pa ste zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag ni sngon gyi mtha'i dang po nyid du rab tu 'gyur ro // yang srid pa nas srid pa zhes bya ba'i bar de ni phyi ma'i mtha' ba'i ltos pa ste zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: Thus, ignorance and the formative forces are the first at the prior limit.üîΩThe passage from existence to existence up to the statement, ‚Äúthe prior limit is not discerned‚Äù is the prior limit.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya la /üîΩde skye ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya la / de skye ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The prior limit is the past.üîΩThe prior limit is the prior limit of the present continuum of the personality.

original: da ltar byung ba'i ming dang @82a * //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i ming dang @82a * //
translated: The present name-and-form is the present.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni mtha'i bar nyid du rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni mtha'i bar nyid du rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: The present name-and-form is the present continuum of the personality.

original: de la sred pa dang len pa tshor ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gnas rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa ni ming nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la sred pa dang len pa tshor ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gnas rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa ni ming nyid yin no //
translated: The present craving and grasping that are associated with feeling, etc., and that are accompanied by consciousness are the present name.

original: srid pa ni las yin pa'i phyir la las ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir skye mched lnga po dag gzugs nyid yin no //
analyzed: srid pa ni las yin pa'i phyir la las ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yin pa'i phyir skye mched lnga po dag gzugs nyid yin no //
translated: Existence is action, and action is derivative form, thus the five sense spheres are form.

original: 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gags pa ni dang po nyid du rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir 'gags pa ni dang po nyid du rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: Cessation is the first, because it is the nature of cessation.

original: 'di ltar sred pa dang len pa nyid 'gags pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pa dang len pa nyid 'gags pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, craving and grasping are called ignorance when they are in a state of cessation.

original: srid pa las 'gags na 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o //üîΩde ltar na ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag kyang bar dang phyi ma'i mtha' nyid du rab tu 'gyur la ;
analyzed: srid pa las 'gags na 'du byed rnams zhes bya'o // de ltar na ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag kyang bar dang phyi ma'i mtha' nyid du rab tu 'gyur la ;
translated: When they cease in relation to existence, they are called formations.üîΩThus, ignorance and formations are the first and last limits.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' sred pa dang len pa rnam shes dang po dang bar ma nyid du rab tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' sred pa dang len pa rnam shes dang po dang bar ma nyid du rab tu 'gyur te /
translated: The last limit is craving and grasping, and consciousness is the middle.

original: dngos po khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gnas skabs kyi dbang gis ming gzhan du btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / gnas skabs kyi dbang gis ming gzhan du btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in substance, and because they are designated by other names in accordance with their states.

original: de ltar na dang po nyid ma nges pa'i phyir zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po nyid ma nges pa'i phyir zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin te /
translated: Thus, because the first is not ascertained, it is like a waterwheel.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the two modes of the beginningless cycle of existence are explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa dgu ste zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa ni rnam pa dgu ste zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, the complete analysis of all modes is ninefold.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su brtag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su brtag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two modes of the beginningless cycle of existence are included in this analysis.

original: byis pa rnams srid pa'i lugs su 'byung ba'i phyir sna tshogs nyid du yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams srid pa'i lugs su 'byung ba'i phyir sna tshogs nyid du yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: The complete analysis of diversity is due to the diversity of the modes of existence of beings.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i lugs su 'byung bar yongs su brtag pa ste lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How is this?üîΩIt is said, ‚ÄúDue to the condition of ignorance, there are karmic formations,‚Äù and so on, which is the complete analysis of the modes of existence of beings.üîΩThe complete analysis of the cause is due to the diversity of craving for the desire realm and the formless realm.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu sna tshogs bas 'bras bu sna tshogs pa nyid du shes par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu sna tshogs bas 'bras bu sna tshogs pa nyid du shes par byas pa yin te /
translated: The complete analysis of the result is due to the diversity of the results of the cause.

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs pa nyid du yongs su brtag pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the diversity is imagined.

original: sred pa smos pa ni srid pa yongs su gzung bar bya ba la de'i nus pa lhag par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa smos pa ni srid pa yongs su gzung bar bya ba la de'i nus pa lhag par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of craving is for the purpose of understanding the power of grasping existence.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa rnam pa dag ni de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su brtag pa rnam pa dag ni de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the aspects of the imagination of what is unreal should be understood.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor brtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so sor brtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that dependent origination is to be examined in all aspects.

original: de dag thams cad kyang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa dgur zad de de las lhag pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa dgur zad de de las lhag pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All of them are included in the nine aspects as explained, because there are no other aspects than these.

original: de lta bu ni mi @82b gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni mi @82b gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the distinctive practice of the non-abiding path.

original: mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i lam sgrub pa'i khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the distinctive practice of the non-abiding path,

original: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bdun du bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bdun du bstan te /
translated: its result is taught in seven aspects.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gnyen po dang ni mi mthun pa'i //
analyzed: gnyen po dang ni mi mthun pa'i //
translated: The antidote and the discordant

original: phyogs nyams pa dang sgrub pa dang // gnas pa dang ni ting 'dzin dang // bsam ba dag ni thob pa dang // nus pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'di //
analyzed: phyogs nyams pa dang sgrub pa dang // gnas pa dang ni ting 'dzin dang // bsam ba dag ni thob pa dang // nus pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'di //
translated: from the point of view of the attainment of a pure attitude,üîΩand from the point of view of ability.

original: rnam pa bdun du rnams shes bya //üîΩgnyen po'i khyad par thob pa dang // mi mthun pa yi phyogs nyams pa //üîΩzhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis su bya ba'i phyir dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis su byas pa'i phyir /üîΩ'bras bu rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun du rnams shes bya // gnyen po'i khyad par thob pa dang // mi mthun pa yi phyogs nyams pa // zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis su bya ba'i phyir dang / sgrub pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis su byas pa'i phyir / 'bras bu rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: The result is known as sevenfold.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.

original: rgyu yi rjes su byed pa'i phyir //üîΩde yang khyad par 'phags par bshad //
analyzed: rgyu yi rjes su byed pa'i phyir // de yang khyad par 'phags par bshad //
translated: The result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.

original: sa drug pa la mi gnas pa'i lam gyi khyad par thob pa gang yin pa de sa lnga pas chos khyad du 'phags pa'i phyir 'bras bu gang yin pa de yang ches khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa drug pa la mi gnas pa'i lam gyi khyad par thob pa gang yin pa de sa lnga pas chos khyad du 'phags pa'i phyir 'bras bu gang yin pa de yang ches khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.üîΩThe result is known as sevenfold from the point of view of the side that is relinquished, from the point of view of the side that is accomplished, and from the point of view of the side that is maintained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyu yi rjes su byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu yi rjes su byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it follows the cause.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yi //
translated: It is the dependent origination

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgnyen po ji ltar rigs par ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gnyen po ji ltar rigs par ni //
translated: of the three times.üîΩThe antidote is the meditation on the doors of liberation,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo sgom pa'o //

original: mtshan ma med pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su ston to //

original: ji lta zhe na /

original: ji lta zhe na /

original: yid tsam skyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yid tsam skyur ba bzhin no //

original: sems can gyi don du mtshan ma kun du spyod pa'i phyir gtan du spangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du mtshan ma kun du spyod pa'i phyir gtan du spangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not abandoned forever, because one engages in all the signs for the sake of sentient beings.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de yid tsam nyams pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de yid tsam nyams pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed pa'i phyir /

original: srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de 'gags pa yin gyi /

analyzed: sems can gyi don du srid pa'i yan lag rnams kun du ston pa'i phyir srid pa'i yan lag rnams nyid 'gag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /

original: de ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid tsam nyams pa ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rang bzhin 'gags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yid tsam nyams pa ni srid pa'i yan lag rnams kyi rang bzhin 'gags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the mere weakening of the resistance is the cessation of the nature of the limbs of existence.

original: rnam par thar pa shin tu nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa shin tu nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po rnyed pa ste /

translated: Because he enters into the door of liberation that is signless up to the stage of Buddhahood, he has attained the counteragent to signs.

original: de lta bas na gnyen po rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyen po rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has attained the counteragent.

original: chos kyi mtshan ma gang yang mi skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba'o //

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i yan lag gi rang bzhin 'gags pa la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa 'di dag gi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: Therefore, the door of liberation that is signless is produced means that the cessation of the limbs of existence and so on, which have been explained in this way, are the reason.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du gtong zhing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /

translated: The nature of the ≈õrƒÅvaka‚Äôs wishlessness is also non-desire, but that is abandoned because of the desire to mature sentient beings.

analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i smon pa med pa ni sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mngon par 'dod pas khyad du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva‚Äôs wishlessness is distinguished by the desire to mature sentient beings.

original: de ltar de'i smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa gsum dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar de'i smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa gsum dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: drug pa 'di la ni mnyam pa nyid rnams kyis yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral te /

original: de lta bu ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs @84a * //üîΩnyams pa'i khyad par yin no //

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
